Reviews.Title: “Nice place, clean rooms (except we had ants from the patio)”
Reviews.Author: Adam B
Reviews.Content: We had a family suite. Rooms 512 & 514. Rooms are nice. Hardwood floors, granite in the bathrooms. Bidet next to the toilet. Large patio. Only issues: - WiFi was hit and miss. Password changes every 24hrs. Front Desk helped with work around. - Free shuttle only picks up/drops off at two locations in town, neither are near major sites, but are near the metro. - Our room had an ant problem in both bathrooms. Wasn't horrible, but certainly noticeable. - No pool or gym onsite.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it if you can...”
Reviews.Author: Sonderby
Reviews.Content: Booked this as a backup for our Easter break in Rome, and unfortunately was unable to find anything else given the short time we had to find something. The location is not great, and the neighbouring area is very uninspiring. The shuttlebus which was at least an attempt to mitigate this was too often full. They should either have a larger vehicle or have an extra one to increase the frequency (perhaps to another drop off point as well??). We ended up having to use taxis 80% of the time regardless. The rooms are not great, very tired looking and small. Breakfast was a non-event, stale bread and cakes from previous day always available. The high chair we used always came back to us every morning filthy from previous use, they couldn't even bother to wipe it down after others had used it. We would it clean it before and after using it and it would always come back dirty... very lazy service. Coffee is dreadful, juice is from a carton. Unfortunately nowhere obvious to go nearby as an alternative, only positive was that breakfast was incl in the rate Receptionist quality varied. Some where helpful some seemed greatly disinterested. On check out we arrived 30mins before our car pick up to settle the bill, but there was no recpetionist 'qualified' to do the check out "back in 5mins" we were told.... 20mins later we ask what's going on, and she calls the guy who was just next door! We then have issues with the payment due to the card and we are suddenly stressing to leave on time as planned, all because of this. There should ALWAYS be someone to do checkouts at a hotel reception 24/7 We booked a car to take us to the airport (EUR65 service) who when we arrived had a child seat for our baby daughter. When we left however we also booked a car, but the recpetionists couldn't be bothered to call us and confirm the booking had been made. Despite reminding them we had a daughter and needed a child seat (most hotels know if you have a child with you regardless either by looking at your booking or by being just the slightest bit attentive when they see you everyday), however the hotel had not remebered to add the child seat to the booking for the 40min drive to the airport. We were furious, but at this time we were already late and had to leave in the car quickly. avoid avoid avoid....

Reviews.Title: “Big Letdown”
Reviews.Author: Lanedomain
Reviews.Content: I have received several emails from various sites -- FamilyGetaway, SniqueAway, all touting this hotel. Can't understand why. We ended up booking a Family Room through Hotels.com, which on their site claims there are two double beds and two twin beds, and "Rich red furnishings on the 6th floor room." When we arrived, we were booked into the very dark 4th floor rooms (next to a screaming child), where we discovered two beds in the two adjoining rooms -- no twins. When I discussed this with the front desk, they claimed that there was no such room at the hotel. Taking this up with Hotels.com ( if anyone has ever tried to resolve something with them, I feel your pain) on the third call they said they were in contact with the hotel, and the hotel would not release us from the booking without charging us for 2 nights. So terrible service aside, let me comment about the rooms. Small. Dark. With a bathroom that is so small you have to turn sideways to get past the sink. The location -- way out of town, in a modern, charmless residential neighborhood. I hope the sites touting this hotel actually come visit the Duke, and take a test drive. Or try to walk through the bathroom. It's a mystery to me why they like this place so much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChristerN
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with high service level. The suit was fantastic and room service fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jfw3
Reviews.Content: I am pleased to say that our stay at the Duke was wonderful thanks to the staff. Two staff members stand out because of their friendliness and their helpful attitudes. The front desk folks were, in general, very helpful. However, Alessandro Biavati was particularly helpful. He was very enthusiastic and friendly. He always had a smile on his face and made an enthusiastic effort to be helpful whenever we asked a question on any topic during our stay. ranging from printing maps to restaurants to helping with printing boarding passes for our flight out of Rome. Never once did I feel that he was annoyed by our requests or questions. He was eager to help. Marco Di Pardo (I think), the staff person in the Polo Lounge for most of the week, was equally helpful and friendly. He also had no issues communicating with us in English. He gave us great advice and helpful hints on life in Rome in general. Francesco, in the Polo Lounge at the end of the week, was also friendly, sincere and helpful. Again, no hesitation to communicate with us in English. The breakfast staff was friendly and polite as well. I do have some criticism of the hotel. The lack of patio furniture on the balconies. It would have been nice to sit out on the balcony with a glass of wine and reflect on what we had visited during the day. And, one of the front desk individuals, (not Massimo who was the reason we selected the hotel in the first place based on Internet reviews. He lived up to those glowing reviews), was not particularly friendly and I did not get his name. I didn’t see him anymore after midweek. Also, the immediate area around the hotel is a bit run down so to speak. Not the fault of the hotel. But, there's a nice little grocery two store fronts down which can provide nice cold cuts and cheeses, inexpensive wines, etc. for snacks and such. They too were friendly and helpful. If any friends are traveling to Rome in the future, I would enthusiastically recommend The Duke. The rooms and property are very nice. The staff is the best that I’ve ever experienced in my travels. We were a group of Americans who could barely say “boungiorno,” much less communicate in any meaningful way in Italian with the staff in an unfamiliar big city. Yet, we were made to feel welcome by The Duke personnel. Thanks for making our trip to Rome such a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Trying to book a room with Duke”
Reviews.Author: gallgbaron
Reviews.Content: I have lived and stayed in Rome (and Italy) many times over 40 years. I am use to the laid back attitudes. I wrote seeking confirmation of deals with Duke Hotel reservations and at first all went well, till I checked what was being advertised and actually offered. I sent links to their own website showing the price discrepancies, which were as much as a few hundred euro. I received a very snotty email from the woman in reservations I had dealt with telling me she refused to book the hotel for me and if I wanted go to the website! rude and childish. I decided to contact hotel management but was told over several days, he is not here, another time he is on holiday, he will be here tomorrow. He (the general manager) was never available. After a while the front desk would just cut me off. I travel a lot (30-35 countries a year). I m well use to hotels but never came across such an amateur crew in my life. The owners I pity, profits are walking if this is the attitude of their operations team.

Reviews.Title: “First visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Quireboy
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel, we had breakfast and lunch and it was really good. I think the hotel would benfit from having a proper bar instead of a table with drinks on. Be warned - a real let down for me and several members of my party was the fact that there were no tea and cofffe making facilities in the rooms. I really couldn't believe that and I have stayed in far more sub standard hotels that do have such facilities. It was a real shame that the hotel let itself down so badly in this aspect as it really spoilt my stay. If you are going to stay there then you need to pack a travel kettle. The restaurant and bar staff were very friendly, less so the reception staff, and we had to carry our own cases to the room,

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Desnathan
Reviews.Content: It is an older hotel which is superbly run. Massimo and his team were fantastic. I would highly recommend this hotel. Peter and Des Nathaniel.

Reviews.Title: “Not good enough.”
Reviews.Author: RB4917
Reviews.Content: Promises so much and fell short on so many counts. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing in snow emergency!”
Reviews.Author: james j
Reviews.Content: The staff of this hotel are coping with warmth and super professionalism during the unusual snow. It seemed the entire population of the hotel descended to the dining room and lounge for dinner yesterday and Enzo the chief waiter was a hero. With one assistant, he served us all with expertise and kindness. After he apparently had just 3 hours sleep he was back, tired but expert once again at breakfast. It is such staff that recommend a hotel the best. Thank you! james judd

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad experiences”
Reviews.Author: JC L
Reviews.Content: Situated in a very quite residential area. Having read through the reviews about getting to the Hotel from the metro, me and my friend were still lost. Anyway, got there by asking few bystanders. Upon arrival, was welcomed by a very rude reciption guy called Fabio. He constantly showed various unhappy signs and was very rude throughout the registration period and wasn't very keen to explain the information we enquired. On the check-out day, Fabio was at the check-out desk and we went through the payment procedure. Earlier yesterday, we booked the free shuttle for 9AM in the morning and we needed it on time because we had to get to the airport. The driver wasn't there at about 9.10AM so we had to ask Fabio to ring the driver. He did not do as we told and only assured ''he is coming soon''. We asked again if the driver was coming, and he finally picked up the phone and started shouting on the phone about the driver's whereabouts. The driver was late for 20mins and did not express any apologies. We were lucky we managed to catch our bus at theTermini (just in there) to the airport. On a good side, hotel room is huge and for those who like proper european-taste rooms will like it. I personally quite enjoyed my sleeps in Duke. Dinner in the restaurant downstairs was proper excellent, both food and service. Overall, bad and good experiences. let you guys do the judgement.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aoo1
Reviews.Content: Both my GF and I have stayed in genuine 5 star across the world, and so we have quite high expectations. IF hotels claim to be of a certain level, we look at all aspects that contribute to this. This hotel is a bit of an enigma. Everything I have read on trip advisor is true; staff can be abrupt and come across rude, a/c heating did not work and at night we had to use the second duvet cover, breakfast was not the greatest, the lifts were big enough for 2 people and the location was out of the way. However since we read quite bad reviews, we went there with absolutely no expectations and hoped for the best. What we found surpised us, but in a good way; the rooms were clean and large with seperate wardrobe, the shuttle bus was excellent as long as you booked in advance, even when it was booked up the front desk went out of their way to help you i.e they would put an additional time on or drop you to another location such as the Vatican, although we initially found front desk to be rather rude, as the days went on, I put this down to their inability to cope when it was hectic. When things were quieter, they found time to help guide us, and look after us, which meant they were consciencious about the guests although just couldn't handle it when it was busy. We both felt that for the money we paid (we got a deal off Voyage Prive), the shuttle bus making up for the location, all in all we were rather satisfied. Which is suprising because of my introduction on this review. Take this hotel as a bog standard 3 possible 4 star and try to catch the staff on down time and make sure you plan with the shuttle bus will make a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shell2403
Reviews.Content: The hotel was warm and inviting. It isnt centrally located but the shuttle bus service provided made everything easy to access and meant that the location wasnt an issue. You do however need to make sure to book the service in advance. The area itself is quiet and noise polution is not a problem. Our sleep however was interupted by a rude neighbour shouting in the corridors late at night and in the early hours of the morning. I dont blame the hotel for that, you get those people everywhere. The staff were friendly and helpful - the bus driver Luigi was really lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: mhg
Reviews.Content: A beautiful room, not very large but with a walk-in-closet (!) and a spacious bathroom. Rich colours and patterns on the drapes and bedspread gave it a touch of elegance. Maybe a bit dated in detalis like faucets but still well kept. The lounges are huge for a hotel of this size and furnished in a traditional, cosy style. Great breakfast buffet (to be in southern Europe) with very tasy salami, lots of fresh fruit and pastries. And sparkling wine, if you want to start the day that way. The surrondings might not look very posh, but the fact that several embassies are situated there gives a hint of what kind of neighbourhood it is. A bit off from the main sights, but, on the other hand, very quiet and safe. Our room faced the street but there was no traffic at all. The shuttle bus is very convenient, and a metro station is only a few minutes walk away. One stop takes you to Piazza del Popolo, wirh walking distance to the Spanish steps etc. The staff is very polite and friendly - but a bit "overdressed"....

Reviews.Title: “THE DUKE HOTEL 10 OUT 10”
Reviews.Author: pmeiss
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, the staff are top nodge! Allessandro & Luigi are GREAT, and very very helpful. Luigi drives the shuttle as well, and is an entertaining man! The hotel shuttle makes it easy, as you can stay in luxury, and quite surroundings, yet can get to the heart of the Rome action in minutes. VERY good value for money! Breakfast are good, rooms are extremely clean and tidy!

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: michael157
Reviews.Content: We have stayed all over, but this may have been the best and most professionally run hotel we have seen. A little off the beaten path, but they made up for it with service and a quiet home like environment. At the front desk, Massimo, Fabio? and ilna? were the best. Our Itaian was lacking and they jumped at the chance to help and made many of our travel plans for us. The breakfast was way over the top, the bar service, excellent and the dinners were exquisite. Fabrizio, the chef could have his own prime time cooking show in America and in a few weeks audiences would be saying "Emeril who". Thanks again Duke!

Reviews.Title: “glamorous years ago in quiet area but not as described on homepage”
Reviews.Author: barbaraebner
Reviews.Content: situated in an upscale quiet area close to shopping etc. is just not right. quiet yes, unless the vacuum cleaner a floor higher doesn't wake you up at 9 on a Saturday morning, walking distance to nothing. But there is a hotel shuttle bus for 6 passengers which you can book FREE every half hour downtown (Plaza del Populo) and back. Book early if you want to go in the morning! it takes about 10 min. The staff was VERY helpful, polite and accomodating but if the standard of the so called 4* Hotel isn't one it is difficult. I was escorded to the so called business center of the hotel (one computer in the corner of some floor) only to be told to wait half an hour until the other guests would probably finished. (a joke, if you want to print a boarding pass). our room 325 boasted a view to the balconies opposite in about 10 m distance stuffed with cartons and debris, not romantic at all. This room is posted at 550 Euros a night - ouff. the ceiling height and room size is nice. Air condition works, but it is not very welcoming. The matraze wasn't covered by a protector and very hard. the flat sheet covered something which looked exactly like the curtain and didn't look as it was being washed every time the clients changed. Old fashioned bath, spacious but no light at above the bathtub which functioned as a shower. BUT a bidet next to the toilet. All in all a one time maybe fancy hotel but past the time. What really appalled me was the ham and salami at the breakfast, being in the food business I saw at the first sight it was dirt cheap what you would not want to eat at all. WHY??? When I asked the room service to send me two glasses and a bucket of ice they first refused and than gave in when I demanded 4* need to supply that - after telling me ice is only available at the bar. Facit: not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dzhavad M
Reviews.Content: Excellent and beautiful hotel! Located in a quiet and very comfortable place in Rome! Spacious rooms with all facilities for all guests! Huge beds and spacious bathrooms! Very good service and polite staff! Great food for breakfast! Free shuttle to the tourist center of the city (3-5 minutes)! Very reasonable prices!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous! Makes Rome a better place to visit!!”
Reviews.Author: guzzles
Reviews.Content: After a very bad experience at another hotel in Rome earlier in the day, the wonderful staff of The Duke came to our rescue - after I placed an emergency call to them for help. Literally, they came to our rescue. If we had not found the Duke, we would have booked the next flight to Canada. We will forever be grateful to the management and staff of the Duke. They were extremely helpful and accommodating - after arriving with no reservations from Canada - We spent our entire week at The Duke. A quiet neighbourhood, with a shuttle to the downtown was just what we were looking for. Beautiful lounges to visit with other tourists after a long day of sight seeing. Thank you! I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We found the price to be reasonable, given the quality, cleanliness and safety afforded to us at the Duke.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Charming and Charismatic. Above and Beyond!!!”
Reviews.Author: DrRounds+
Reviews.Content: Our first stay in Rome. The Duke was a phenomenal experience. The hotel sits in a quiet neighborhood 5 min (€7 via taxi) away from the heart of it all. 9 times out of 10, we used the free shuttle (every 1/2 hour) back and forth to Piazza del Popolo. The rooms have it all, very clean, comfortable and are turned over in under 15 minutes. Breakfast (included) is out of this world. The variety is outstanding and open buffet style all you can eat. We will always remember the staff who made our stay wonderfully inviting and welcome especially Massimo and Luigi. We'll be back for our next anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: DRBChicago
Reviews.Content: Ants, ants and more ants. It took the hotel 4 tries before they got rid of them. They were crawling on our robes, soap and in the tub. The hotel is also not very close to anything. Although they did have a free shuttle to take you to the action it was just too inconvenient. For the price of this hotel it is much better to be within walking distance to the sights you are there to see. The breakfast was good but overall I thought the staff was cold and inpersonable. This hotel should be left for the business traveller. 4 euro 50 to wash a pair of underwear and 35 euro to go to the gym. I would never stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, well appointed but airco lacking”
Reviews.Author: mcmcBill
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night early July for business. The main advantage of this hotel is that it is in a quiet residential area, away from the bussy spots, but closeby enough. It was very hot and humid and the cooling comes from a thermostat controlled cold water radiator with a blower. This was insuffient to cool the room on my stay. Another disadvantage is that there are only Italian channels on TV, so not even able to look at some international news channel or so. Breakfast more than adequate, very good actually.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out for Web Site”
Reviews.Author: JackRabbit88
Reviews.Content: I had a positively awful experience with the Duke Hotel's lack of customer service. I booked on the web and it apparently double entered the booking but nothing indicated this was the case. I canceled the booking later using the one and only reservation number I had and received a cancellation number. To my surprise, I was charged a one day fee of $750 on my credit card as a "no show." Despite my writing to them repeatedly and producing the cancellation number, they claimed, "it was not a valid number" and refused to credit my account. There was no "welcome" Email or anything else that would have clued me that there was a reservation pending in their system. Other so called five star hotels always send a "welcome message." In spite of my offer of a compromise by giving me a credit for future use, they ignored all requests. Be prepared if you go to the Duke Hotel, their decisions are final even if they are wrong and there's nothing you can do about it. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone traveling internationally as it is nearly impossible to communicate with them.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service and lukewarm amenities”
Reviews.Author: steff0566
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights when we attended a conference. We pre-booked a hotel car to pick us up, which didn't show up. No apologies were made at check-in, other than to say that we should have called from the airport information booth. (My cell did not work , and we could not find an information booth, but needless to say, the no-show was not our fault). While we waited at check-in, another guest appeared at the desk to inform the concierge that the lights did not work in her room, and another guest called to say that she did not get her wake-up call. Not a good sign. The air-con in our room barely worked, but the room was otherwise pleasant. Wifi is not free either. I have only been here half a day but this alleged 4-star hotel is a big disappointment for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a quiet neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: LLBSacto
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a quiet neighborhood. The staff is wonderful and accomodating. Everyone at the hotel is helpful. There is a supermarket about two blocks away. This hotel is a nice oasis from the chaos of Rome, especially during the busy tourist season. Easy cab ride to the Spanish Steps or take the hotel shuttle. The staff treated my infant daughter like a princess, including setting up a crib in our room and a gift of a wooden music box. My husband and I were there for business for one week. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Worldhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at The Duke. The front office staff were extremely helpful and assisted us in making contact with the car company we had booked from Australia. The lounge bar attendant was very friendly and the services he provided were exemplary! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Aging hotel in need of new restauant”
Reviews.Author: Nan791
Reviews.Content: The Duke Hotel is located far off the beaten path in a residential neighborhood with few restaurants or shopping nearby. Though the personnel are cheerful and try to satisfy guests, the lobby floor in all its areas is gloomy and in need of renovation. The rooms are well-furnished and ours was large for Rome. But the restaurant food is so terrible (we dined there one night) that only one other hapless couple was there. The food was tasteless, lacking in imagination, poorly served; even the breakfasts were only marginal, unless you retreated to the safety of small rolls. The hotel might be a nice one again in the future but it needs investment and change.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if you want to be away from chaos of Rome inner city”
Reviews.Author: Sharon91302
Reviews.Content: I think all reviews of this hotel are acurate. The subjective part is related to personal choice to be near or away from city center. I travel alot for business, so when I am on vacation, I do not enjoy being in the middle of everything near the city only to be awaken by midnight party goers. I liked the quiet neighborhood feel and though there were some very interesting walks in the area albeit not tourist sights. The quaint neighborhood and really terrific service are a nice combination. I like the quiet nights of sleep followed by an amazing buffet in the morning. The only complaint is the distance from the city. You need to take a short walk (about 15 min) to the train station or use their coach service which takes you to the Spanish Steps. that was convenient but not as nice as being right in the heart of things. The trade off for me was worth it. People wanting the party atmosphere of Rome at 2:00 am should not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bsbiradar
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in the center of Rome, hotel has free drop and pick up to Piazza del popolo, which is a great advantage for people who want to explore Rome. Staff are extremely friendly and nice, room service is good and i would go to this place when i travel to Rome next time

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Matched by Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: chinnudc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautifully appointed and the rooms are large, clean and modern. The hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood and offers a shuttle service to/from the Piazza del Popolo every 30 minutes. The Manager, Massimo, was extremely friendly and helpful. He went the extra mile, above and beyond the call of duty, to do whatever was necessary to make our stay pleasant and enjoyable. The breakfast buffet is quite substantial and offers a lot of variety. Food prices are relatively inexpensive in the hotel restaurant and the quality of the food was outstanding. I highly recommend The Duke Hotel and would give it 5 stars for overall quality and service.

Reviews.Title: “noisy rooms - quiet location in dull residential area”
Reviews.Author: cside2b
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located north of the city center in a very quiet residential district with hardly any bars, restaurants or shops. This is in itself would not be a problem but the hotel itself does not have a bar or restaurant. It does however, provide a good buffet breakfast and extensive room service. The rooms are pleasantly decorated but with barely any noise insulation. There was a vent in the room which seemed to have water leaking into it and sounded like rain on a tin roof at times. At other times the wind howled through it. A group returning late congregated in the room next to ours and made a huge amount of noise until the early hours - presumably they had nowhere else to go because the hotel has no bar and there is nowhere to go within walking distance of the hotel. The Sky TV had only one foreign channel working at the time we visited - BBC world. This hotel would be fine for someone visiting friends or relatives in the area but as a tourist it is not worth the detour to the suburbs.

Reviews.Title: “Way off the beaten path; residential neighborhood; choose elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: annstead
Reviews.Content: The Duke Hotel has a magnificent looking website. Unfortunately, the reality doesn't come close. Located in a residential neighborhood north of the city center, north of the Borghese Gardens, north of everything(!)...no cafes nearby, no shops, not even good walking. The hotel itself has no restaurant (save a b'fast buffet set up daily in an interior, drab room), no bar -- unless your group pays for a bartender in the mis-named Polo Lounge -- no cafe or espresso stand, no shop. Rooms are tired and small w/ cheap linens, a broken vanity mirror in my bathroom, barely-there shower, Sky TV doesn't work well enough to get any of the non-Italian speaking stations. Nice enough staff and they try to be accommodating. There is a free shuttle to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “after long day of visiting places it's nice opportunity to come back to your room :)”
Reviews.Author: meekEurope
Reviews.Content: I can fully recommend the place.Very quiet area ,rooms designed with good taste,nice breakfast,very kind service.. The only thing which was quite difficult was the fact it s so far from the centre ,however the Duke has free shuttle bus so if you r lucky and reserve it you can get to the town without any effort.. I bought internet using the internet site and it was quite expensive but my friends were smart enough :) and discovered it is much more cheaper when you are paying for it at the front desk

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but far from the historic center”
Reviews.Author: avidtraveler34
Reviews.Content: The Duke Hotel was a nice European hotel. The rooms were clean and well kept, bathrooms although small were updated and well appointed. Each morning we had a breakfast with a nice assortment of foods no matter what time you arrived, early or late. Although we knew the hotell was in a residential area, it was farther than we expected. Definately not walking distance to anything. Athough it took only minutes for a cab to arrive, the drivers would take us on different routes every day and the same destination would cost anywhere from 5-25 Euros! We looked at it as a sighseeing opportunity each time because our Italian was too limited to discuss the route. The staff was attentive but not overly friendly (with the exception of Massimo and Allesandro who were both wonderful). I thnk they tended to shy away from guests who did not speak fluent Italian as their English was liimited. Last point to make was it was incredibly quiet at night! You could hear a pin drop the neighborhood was so quiet. One of our cab drivers said it was like the Upper East side of Manhattan as far as neighborhoods go - lots of professionals lived in the area. We travel extensively and prefer to stay at smaller boutique hotels. Although it was not a disapointment, we probably would not stay at the Duke again when we return to Rome simply because of its location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but away from sights beware of rome cab drivers”
Reviews.Author: phildiverLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights the roomes are clean AC could be a bit better. The hotel is in the suburbs of Rome but once you get your bearings the local underground is close and the trains are cheap and have good AC you are about 20mins by train from the Colosseum. The hotel has its own shuttle bus to the spanish steps which we used. BEWARE ROME CAB DRIVERS they will con you, they tried it on with me saying that i had given them a 5 Euro note instead of the 20 i had given he did this while i was dealing with the luggage at the hotel and busy it is easy to get taken in by this you have been warned, lots of travel guides will also warn you DON'T TRUST THEM. Overall the hotel was good and the breakfast satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, TERRIBLE Location”
Reviews.Author: SDTraveler909
Reviews.Content: If you have been to Rome before and have already been to all the touristy spots (Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, Colosseum, Vatican, etc.) and instead are looking for an "off-the-beaten-path" Rome trip, then the Duke Hotel will suit you fine. Unfortunately for us, it was my first visit to Rome (my husband had been previously). Of course I wanted to visit the Colosseum, Vatican, Spanish Steps and all the other main attractions of Rome... The location of the Duke Hotel is very inconvenient for travelers wanting to see and experience the main attractions, most of which are in/near the heart of the city. The Duke Hotel, however, sits on the outskirts of the city (in a residential area) and requires a drive that takes anywhere from 10-40 minutes depending on the traffic due to rush hour, road blocks, etc. (A ten minute drive cost us about 10 Euros, just to give you an idea of the cost.) The Duke does provide a complimentary "shuttle" but it only can take 7 people at a time and you need to make a reservation for the shuttle for both your transport into the city and back to the hotel. This was fine for our morning ride into the city, but difficult for our ride back as we often did not know what time we would be ready to head back to the hotel. Worrying that we were going to miss our shuttle back to the hotel became something we basically wrote off and just started taking taxis if necessary. We were also told by the concierge that if we showed up at the pick up location without a reservation, it was likely that we would not be allowed on due to other guests' reservations... In sum, I would say the hotel's major downfall was its location. And just as a side note, I was not wholly impressed with the room - it was small, wood floor, with a bed that could not have been any firmer. Due to the wood floors, every night (or early morning, I should say) we could hear the people on the floor above us come home and walk around until they took their shoes off. This definitely has a B&B feel, rather than "luxury" hotel. However, all that said, the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful (especially Luigi!!! We loved Luigi!). The Duke provided a beautiful breakfast every morning that was included with the room. But when it comes down it, the location kills this hotel if you plan on spending time seeing Rome and all of its amazing sights. (While walking back to the shuttle pick-up location, we decided the next time we visit, we'll stay at the Eden Hotel, Intercontinental, or even the Westin that was not too far from the city center. Staying at a hotel within walking distance would be WELL-WORTH the money...)

Reviews.Title: “The Duke Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fabioss
Reviews.Content: Very good Hotel. The employees are very friendly. One bad aspect; the location of the hotel is far away from the centre of the most city atractions, but the hotel provides a shuttle service for free that takes you to the center of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great service.”
Reviews.Author: kjbms
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome in Sept 2010. The Duke was not in the center of town but a quick shuttle ride away, which the hotel provides free of charge. The hotel was quiet and relaxing. Rooms were small but provided everything we needed. The only thing we didn't like about our room was the temperature; it stayed hot and never really cooled off. The concierge was friendly and always eager to help. I would stay here again if visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: foggyrabbit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duke Hotel for 2 nights in mid-August. and were very pleased with this hotel. The hotel and the neighbourhood were very quiet, as many Romans were away on their vacations (indeed, Rome seemed like a ghost town when we first arrived on August 19). The staff were very warm and friendly when we arrived, and our rooms were quite nice - clean, quiet and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was excellent, offering a nice variety of items: eggs, pastries, yogurt, fresh fruit. The public areas of the hotel were inviting and elegant. As others have pointed out, the hotel is some distance away from the centre of town, and the shuttle only seats seven people. However, we never had any problem reserving seats for four people on the shuttle, and the shuttle is a short 10 minute drive to the drop-off location. The shuttle drop-off is an easy walk to the Spanish Steps, Via Veneto, and the Trevi Fountain. We may have had better luck booking the shuttle than others, as the hotel was so quiet when we were there (I believe they only had 46 people in total booked). The service was excellent throughout our stay. The staff were always helpful, calling restaurants on our behalf to confirm whether they were open (many restaurants were closed for 2 weeks in August). When it came time for our departure, the hotel manager arranged to have us driven to the train station in the hotel shuttle as he was concerned we would not make our train if we waited for a taxi. So, would I stay in this hotel again or recommend it to others? Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - a bit out of the centre”
Reviews.Author: Familyfun84
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights and had a lovely stay. We got a jr suite and room was clean, spacious and comfortable with excellent air-con. We had a nice king bed and kids slept on a sofa bed and all slept well. The room had a safe, bathrobes and a minibar however there are no tea making facilites and the Sky tv cable box was only partially working. Overall room was very comfortable and of high 4 star quality even at North America standards. Breakfast was quite good with fresh breads, cold cuts, cheese, eggs, yoghurt and we loved the cheese cake and the spiga bread. Staff was very helpful and polite. Hotel is a bit out of the centre, and there is a shuttle however we did not use it. It is only available every half hour and needs to be booked. A taxi to Piazza Navona was 12 euros or to Spanish Steps 10 euros and took only 10 minutes. Rome taxi drivers all knew about the hotel and we never paid more than 15 euros for a cab ride. The hotel is in a nice residential neighbourhood so there are no restaurants near by - there is a Carrefour supermarket 5 minutes walk from for groceries. So you must be downtown for dinner or lunch. We did not eat dinner at the hotel but heard from other guests that food quality is high. There is no pool or gym so we only used the hotel for B&B however we spent all days till 10 pm touring Rome and were glad to come back to our room and seek shelter from the hot and humid summer. Overall a comfortable and pleasent hotel of good 4 star quality, excellent service and modern rooms. We would choose it again as a base to explore Rome.

Reviews.Title: “could do better!”
Reviews.Author: sparkle1967
Reviews.Content: Let's start on the positives: Excellent breakfast Clean sheets and towels General housekeeping Beautiful polo lounge However, the location is much further from the centre than anticipated. The walk back is uphill...not great when very hot. The shuttle service is too regimented and only available at the hotels convenience. Drinks are very very expensive 10 euros for a cocktail and the bar arrangement is odd. Rooms are dated and need balcony furniture. When we were there a business conference was taking place. The management allowed the company concerned to take over all the leisure areas and to erect flip charts and notice boards in both lounge areas and reception. On returning to the hotel after a long day we had to sit behind a hugh notice board in the corner of the room and at breakfast we had to walk through loads of people whilst their meeting was in session. Also we went down for breakfast within time only to find that the tables had been cleared but coffee and cakes were available for the business guests only. Noisy in the mornings from 6.00am. Fillipo the manager and the shuttle drivers were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “far from fantastik”
Reviews.Author: stellaCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: i have invited my family to a trip to Rome this year and aloud them to book a hotel but that was a big mistake. this hotel was to far from the centre of the city, we no view. i was extremely disappointed in the service and specially in cleaning, i had to tell them several times that they should clean the floors. they kept on promising to send the bell boy up with the mane key for our entrance but never did.... wow it was bed for the money i paid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ArielDL
Reviews.Content: Rome is Rome. A beauty!!! The Duke is an excellent hotel, people are really nice!! We got a room with a beautiful balcony and a nice view of a residential area of Rome. Location is in a residential area close to the Villa Borghese. There is a shuttle that goes to a more central location close to the Piazza de Spagna. The shuttle is sometimes full so you have to take a taxi. Breakfast was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel in a Quiet Residential Area of Rome”
Reviews.Author: skynet45
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duke Hotel for 4 nights to celebrate our wedding anniversary and a birthday. Our room was spacious with all the normal facilities including a large bathroom. The only negative point was that the carpet was stained and either needed cleaning or replacing. Breakfast was inclusive and was served as a buffet and offered a wide and well presented choice of hot and cold food. The staff were very helpful and accommodating and nothing was too much trouble for them. We chose the hotel because we wanted somewhere quiet away from the bustle of central Rome. This was certainly the case although the distance to the the nearest points of interest in the city was futher than advertised. The brochure suggested a 15-20 min walk but we found it took us 30 - 40 mins. The walk itself was pleasant enough across the Borghese Gardens but you wouldn't want to do it every day! The hotel offered a free small shuttle bus with a service every 30 mins but you had to book it in advance outward and return. There were a few good restaurants in the immediate area of the Hotel which were within walking distance although the hotel insisted on laying on the shuttle bus! This did have an advantage in that you could just ring for it when you were ready to return. The Hotel did have a restaurant serving lunch and dinner but it had a limited menu and was usually very quiet and consequently had no real atmosphere. Having said that the quality of the food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “look elsewhere dont go off the photos”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller121
Reviews.Content: i and several collegues stayed at this hotel for one night only then moved out next day! why? the photos look good but on closer inspection when you arrive you find they did not give a true picture at all.This hotel may have been very good maybe 20 years ago? now its tired and run down, the staff are helpful but i think they know this hotel is in a state. its location is remote for historical Rome,smack in the middle of an urban highrise jungle, my room looked out on residential appartments that looked like the bronx in New York, the lifts are small and battle scared, the bathrooms are old and not that clean, lots of things dont work in this hotel the air con in the rooms for one , the internet , and lots of public area lighting in hallways etc the list goes on and on,a friend in another room handed his key in at reception and on his return found his room had been given to someone else who had moved in even though all his stuff was still in the room and he had four more days left at the hotel! my advise dont stay here it is not worth the room rate in fact its worth no more than 60 euros a night at best. its got to be one of the worst hotels I have stayed in and I have stayed in hundreds all over the world.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star property”
Reviews.Author: agentsd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Duke hotel the end of April for 6nights. We had great expectations due to the many reviews we had read previously on trip advisor, but were disappointed in many aspects of our stay. The best way to sum things up, is that this is not the 4star property that it claims to be. If we had expected a 3star property, our expectaions would have been more in line of what we got. The hotel is in a lovely location, albiet of the beaten path. The complimetary shuttle helps greatly, but it would be nice to have had a few restaurants nearby. The deli next door helped on nights we did not feel like treking back into town to eat. We had two main problems with this hotel, the first was they advertise on their website, that their rooms are air conditioned and also that they have a lounge area with a nightly piano bar. What they don't say is that both of these ammenities are seasonal. This should absolutley be disclosed. If you are expecting something and do not receive it is where the problem lies. The second problem was the house keeping. The rooms definately needed a bit of an overhall. Our bedspread had a disgusting white stain on the underside and promptly went off the bed never to return. The bed was not comfortable, and the two twins that they put together to make a king were not the same height, so we kept rolling off into the center. Not once did we receive a clean glass(beverages were not even rinsed out) and the towels were just put back on the rack each night. (I know this because there was the same makeup stain on my towel the entire stay). I did leave a note in Italian after about 3days with no clean glasses and did receive for that day only. The next day it was back to dirty glasses with water or wine still left in them. Over all, this is not a bad property. The breakfast is good, shuttle a plus, early morning front desk management were great. It just isn't quite what it claims to be. The price is right, so not a bad choice once you know what you are really paying for.

Reviews.Title: “Molto bene”
Reviews.Author: gigilum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duke for a few days during our honeymoon. Our flight got in @ 10pm but there was someone waiting to help us with our bags as soon as we arrived. Check in was efficient and they gave us a room overlooking a residential building which was ok. The room itself was nice and spacious. The bathroom was large but the shower was located on the side of the tub instead of on the ends, no big deal - but I thought it was weird. The breakfast buffet was wonderful with a good selection of hot and cold foods. It is a bit far from the city center but they did provide a shuttle free of charge and we found that service to be very helpful. The staff is really what makes this hotel shine, they were all helpful, courteous and willing to go the extra mile. We will never forget LUIGI - their jack of all trades employee who was a joy to be around.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, good service, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: dendyp
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome on a business/pleasure mixture. The hotel is not in the absolute centre, but it is only two train-stops out, with ample services nearby. Location is quiet, standards are excellent, bed linen is real linen. Breakfast & dining was as one would expect. Importantly, we were pleased that the house-staff took responsibility for their part in the business, by checking each night that everything was to our satisfaction. We were on the top floor and this did become too hot. The heating from the lower parts of the building would rise tp the top level, so we asked for this to be recified, and it was.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Tripomania
Reviews.Content: My recent trip was capped off by staying in the Duke Hotel. Freindly, proffesional and above all a cracking service. Thanks very much and will be back again

Reviews.Title: “The Duke is The Best”
Reviews.Author: SwamiOfSalami
Reviews.Content: When I left the hotel I wanted to write a review but I forgot. Now I am planning to go back to Rome and was thinking of booking for the Duke. I remembered that I wanted to write a review! Last year it was a great experience. I was there for ferragosto. The people in the hotel were so nice. While it may not be in the center, there is a shuttle that took us to the city. Maybe because it was for ferragosto it was so beautiful. We walked from the center to Villa Borghese. The Central Park of Rome! For the price, this is the best deal I ever found in Rome! I would stay there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Peaceful Setting”
Reviews.Author: CMFRamona
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duke Hotel for six days and discovered staying off the beaten path of Rome was perfect for us. It is not as convenient to many of the attractions of Rome, but the ambiance of the hotel made up for that. The staff is extremely friendly and well spoken and helpful. The rooms are clean and well appointed. We upgraded to the Superior Room which included a buffet breakfast. After six mornings though breakfast became a little too routine, but food was plentiful and staff accomodating. A shuttle is provided by the hotel to get you a little closer to the sites, but we found walking was one of the better ways to get around and great to stroll through the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Nice looking place but staff not very helpful and poor location.”
Reviews.Author: Maast
Reviews.Content: Had to stay there for business. That was poor choice because it's far from everything and that applies for tourist as well. The hotel itself is not ugly but a bit worn out. The staff is very cold and not very helpful (rude staff at the bar, my miles were never posted by my frequent flier program ever after 3 reminders and they still have the BlackBerry charger I lost at the hotel 1 year ago!) Rooms are pretty large though but that doesn't compensate for the rest, particularly at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Choice”
Reviews.Author: DallasChris
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel on our honeymoon and absolutely loved it! We had first class service from the staff, who all seemed to know our names, they all spoke English well enough to communicate and were very friendly. The hotel is beautiful but a bit out of the way. It is a very short and inexpensive cab ride to anywhere you want to go though. Great breakfast buffett too, saved us many Euros instead of eating out... The shuttle service is different, to say the least, make sure to get the schedule and find a phone to call ahead to ask them to pick you up, they only run it on request. I would be nice if they chose a different drop off/pick up point closer to tourist attractions. Our driver did stop a the Ferrari Store on our way back one day so we could admire the Italian craftsmanship. Rooms are spacious and beautiful, ours had a queen sized bed and a balcony. I absolutely would recommend this hotel to anyone. Wonderful service at a wonderful hotel at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful rooms and bathrooms with linen sheet. Amazing stay.”
Reviews.Author: duke02
Reviews.Content: very luxuriously furnished, comfort all the way, good breakfast offsets being in a position which is not really central. Very good value for money. Last but not least the beds: they are so comfortable that it is difficult to wake up.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid adjoining rooms”
Reviews.Author: nickxg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duke hotel for the New Year Period and requested a quiet room at the time of booking. We were allocated a room with an adjoining door to the next room which unfortunately was occupied by younger guests who played their tv at a loud volume each night into the early hours of the morning. We did ask the hotel staff to intervene but their attitude to our complaint was very poor and when we requested a change of room the next morning, the Hotel Manager stated they were unable to move us as the hotel was fully booked. Unfortunatey we spent the following night wearing earplugs as a group of Italian guests decided to have an impromtu party in their room on the floor below which also carried on until the early hours. We can appreciate that our stay coincided with the New Year period, however we were very disappointed that the hotel staff did not take our noise complaints more seriously. Our hotel room was actually of a good size, very clean and comfortable (although the bed was quite hard). The bathroom was relatively modern and the shower, despite being over the bath, was good. We didn't actually eat at the hotel in the evening, choosing instead to eat in town. However, we had breakfast in the hotel on one morning and found it to be of a good standard with helpful waiting staff. The shuttle bus was extremely handy as the hotel is slightly out of town and it's a fair walk back at the end of a tiring day sightseeing. The shuttle bus drivers were friendly and courteous and the service generally ran on time. The bus runs every 45 mins into the town and stops at 22.00 at night, which is ideal if you choose to stay in town for an evening meal. Overall, our main disappointment with the Duke Hotel was two-fold. 1) that the rooms had extremely poor sound proofing to the extent that (in addition to tv noise) you could hear guests in the rooms below and above us opening their wardrobe doors and drawers. You could also hear the guests in the room above walking around as it appears that their bedroom, like ours, had wooden floors. 2) We strongly feel that our complaints were not resolved in an appropriate manner by the hotel reception staff and we spent 2 nights of our 3 night stay having very poor sleep. Top tip : Don't forget to pack some ear-plugs!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, terrible location”
Reviews.Author: MrsSAUK
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our honeymoon and was very disappointed for what we had paid. The room was on the small side, although to be fair it was very clean and a sweet was left on our pillow each evening. The hotel itself was not the problem and the staff were friendly enough. My reason for not recommending this hotel is the location, at least 20 minutes quick pace walk to Spanish Steps and built in a residential area. The 7 seater shuttle bus only runs every half an hour, needless to say it books up quickly and last pick up is at 10pm. This means more often than not you will need a taxi to get to and from the hotel to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: jsmith1962
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through an online agency and were certainly pleased with the choice. We did read some of the reviews here on tripadvisor, and were slightly worried by some of the negative reviews, but I feel they are not justified. Sure, it is a little distance to all the sights, but an easy taxi journey and plenty of taxis passing, and also the hotel shuttle is frequent into town. The staff were very friendly always smiling and welcoming and ready to answer our (many) questions’ Our Room, 518 was large and clean, and quiet, and we found the bed real comfortable and not too hard as many had seemed to complain about.. Breakfast was superb, fresh fruit, omelettes, a huge choice. My only complaint would be that there is a charge for wi-fi. Great hotel, away from the madness of the traffic of Rome, and such friendly staff and good rooms make this hotel worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facility, great staff, but not located for tourists.”
Reviews.Author: jeff f
Reviews.Content: The staff is terrific. Anything you need, you get. Anything they need to do to please, they do. Paid $900 for 2 nites in suite, with dinner and one-way to FCO, which is probably high, considering location and minor disappointments (no outdoor furniture on balcony, poor tv reception and coverage, no coffee until 7 am) but breakfasts and dinner were very good and shuttle car to city center, restaurants, Borgese, etc was a good service. Suite was very large-prob 600-700 sq ft, great bath. I recommend. As for location, very quiet street, no noise, slept great!

Reviews.Title: “NIce - but too far away”
Reviews.Author: peachome
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent recommended this hotel as being a good value for the money in a big city like Rome. We had the same issue as other travelers. This hotel is in a residential area. There supposedly is a train station close - - but it has been closed for construction for awhile so that wasn't an option. The shuttle to the "Spainish steps" drops you off at a not too convenient spot. I agree that they need MORE SHUTTLES and more drop off points to really accomodate city tourists. We ended up doing taxi's - - too expensive. If you leave the hotel in the morning and don't return till late maybe it's ok but if you want to come "home" and refresh or dress up for dinner, then you need another round trip taxi ride. The front desk only seemed to have one local restaurnt to refer us too - and half of it was filled with Duke guests. The meal was ok...but you would want more than one choice for a multiple night stay. Also - while we were there, there was construction nearby so the " quiet residential neighborhood" wasn't an offsetting perk. Our rooms were a decent size had little balconies - - but no table or chairs....odd. Mattress and bedding could have been better - - but I've had worse in similiar hotels in Europe. Breakfast was a plus - nice selection. Front desk staff were very accomodating.....but very busy and had to wait awhile a few times to get assistance. Wi-Fi was another issue. They say they offer it free in the business center. Well, the "business center" is a conference room alcove with one computer. And, if the room is booked for a meeting, you can't get access to the computer - - even if the meeting is out for lunch. (they block the computer from use). In short, our Rome experience would have been more fun if we were closer to the action - - even if it was a little louder!! I do hope the Hotel manager reads these because there are just a few things they could do to make this a better selection - - more shuttles, more drop-off, pick-up points/times, Wi-Fi availability/improved business center equipment and staff knowledge.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: danapd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a weeklong trip to Rome and our goal was to see as much as possible each day. Once we left the hotel for the day, we were out until after dinner. So with that in mind, the location (quiet neighborhood just north of Villa Borghese - Rome's equivalent of Central Park) wasn't an issue because we didn't have the need to go back and forth between the hotel during the day. If you want to be in the middle of everything (which I hear is incredibly noisy), then I would not recommend this hotel only because of the location. We got a great rate on this hotel, and the breakfast alone probably saved us upwards of $30 a day. They really had great food at the buffet and it was nice to fill up for a long day of sightseeing. This was definitely one of the biggest perks to staying here. The free shuttle will drop you off at one of the best hotels in Rome, a block from the Spanish steps. We also experimented with walking through Villa Borghese and heading west of Popolo to get to the Vatican, which was a lovely walk and we got to see some less touristy areas of Rome. The rooms were clean and nice. It was our first time in Europe, but I've always heard that if you're looking for the equivalent of a nice US hotel, you'll pay an arm and a leg. So was it the Ritz? No. Was it nice and acceptable (especially given the rate)? Definitely. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to a friend, especially for what I would expect most people are looking for in Rome - a safe, clean place to spend the night with decent amentities. This is not a resort hotel, but that's not what we needed either.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, plush, out of the way and hard beds.”
Reviews.Author: JN40
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in this luxury hotel in a suburb of Rome. It was very nicely decorated and really felt 4*. The people were very friendly and helpful - nothing was too much trouble. Lovely breakfasts. Linen sheets, tons of towels, super clean. It is out of the way though and the shuttle is limited - they really need to run it far more often and drop guests off in a more convenient place - please take note hotel manager - this would make all the difference! The only other thing you could do to improve matters is get rid of the super-hard beds! Both my husband and I ended up with backache and all the hotel could do was offer an extra blanket. So we slept on the rollaway/sofabed while our 9 and 6 year olds slept on the big bed. The reason I wouldn't recommend it is that the most basic thing any hotel should offer is a decent nights sleep and we didn't get that because of the hard beds.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Duke”
Reviews.Author: JoyfulTraveler65
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a tiny bit off the beaten track - but not to worry - we loved this place, quiet residential neighborhood, nice little restaurants just around the corner, hotel shuttle will take you the 5 minute ride to and back from the center of the city, fantastic breakfast - with Prosecco!!! Staff very friendly, helpful. Would definitely go back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great for repeat travellers.”
Reviews.Author: norma056
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind being a little out of the hot spots then this hotel is excellent value. Service and breakfast were great. Rooms were spacious and spotless. Would definately return. If I had one complaint it is that they should run the shuttle more frequently as the drop off spot is less than 10 mins from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great deal. Quiet and a little out of town but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: JohnathanW
Reviews.Content: We read a lot of reviews on the Roman hotels and chose this one for a 5 night break. we were not disappointed. The rate through the internet was great for B&B although it is expensive once you get there if you want a cocktail or dinner. There is a supermarket just round the corner though which is handy for packed lunches and drinks to keep in the hotel minibar. Talking of drinking, there are a few tabernas around and about, say 10 minute walk from the hotel, but the area is not bustling with nightlife. It's there if you can find it! The staff were excellent and the shuttle bus very welcome as it saves a 40 minute walk into town. Not a huge amount to see nearby but plenty of good walks through the streets and up to Park Borghese which is lovely - especially the Villa which is stunning. All in all, we'd stay again and might even pay a little more for a bigger room - although the 'superior' room we had was plenty big enough for two of us with a good amount of hanging space and a lovely bathroom. Air con was ok but not fantastic but generally the room was very comfortable and it was nice to have SKY etc to watch the odd bit of news and sport in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service nothing was too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: acadaSydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Duke Hotel for 11 nights. The room was compact but very clean- the bathroom was the largest I have seen outside a 5 star hotel in Europe. The breakfast (included) was great. The staff were very helpful and extremely friendly with excellent English- nothig was too much trouble- highly recommended for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: margot1968
Reviews.Content: would recommend this hotel to anyone who has booked a short stay in rome. The rooms are very pretty and immaculate. The hotel is in a residential area approx. 5 min from the centre of rome, but you can walk which takes about 30 min or jump a taxi. Breakfast was lovely and the staff very friendly and could not do enough for you. Be warned Rome in general is VERY expensive....not just a little but vastly overpriced. The restaurants cost a fortune..approx.. £56 for an omelette, a pasta and 2 small beers. YOu will need to take plenty of money in order to survive here. £4 for an ice cream cone!. Overall though, a beautiful hotel and a beautiful city. A visit to villa bourgesi is a must...we walked from hotel and had a fab day walking around this massive park

Reviews.Title: “This can be the perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kensreview
Reviews.Content: The Good: Its been a few days since I first check in and I have to say I like it alot here. Its clean, very quite, cool, and beautiful. As a tourist it pretty much has everything I expect in a good hotel; free breakfast, wifi (not free), wide clean rooms, friendly service, and a free shuttle bus service (its highly recommended to book in advance). So if your wanting to have a great time in Rome and explore its deep city and culture, then I highly recommend this hotel because its only steps away from the main city. Also the hotel is nice enough to have US plug ins so that you can connect your laptop, cellphone charger, etc. Pretty neat. The Bad: Wifi isn't free, but there is a pretty good business center up on the 5th floor. Also if you miss your shuttle bus, your either going to have to wait until the next shuttle bus arrives, walk a pretty long distance to the subway (which can be uncountable and fairly frustrating), or your going to have to use a chunk of your money on a taxi which can also be frustrating. Also people do argue about the location, but I personally somewhat like it. Conclusion: Its a good hotel. I recommend this to anyone who plans on visiting the wonderful city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant and the right place to be”
Reviews.Author: montecarlo_max
Reviews.Content: Right, so if you want to be in the Centre of Rome and have to deal with the millions of people, and the noise generated by those people, then this hotel is NOT for you. However, if like me, you want somewhere peaceful and quiet, a retreat almost, then this place is excellent. The staff were all very friendly and the shuttle made it very handy to get about, at one stage even offering to take us to The Vatican opposed to the drop-off point by The Spanish Steps. Our room (520) was enormous and quite modern, but the hotel is typically Italian with gold-leaf all over the place. It is very nice and makes a change from the typical city hotel that one can get used to. The breakfast was great and the staff attentive. As for dinner, I have no idea because I did not eat in the hotel, but the recommendations for dinner by the Concierge were all amazing - I loved the fact that they showed us on a map exactly where we were going so we could make sure the cab driver was heading in the right direction! I love this place and would happily recommend it to a friend, although it is in the middle of nowhere so dont expect to be able to walk around the area in the evening, unless you need an ATM!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel out of the chaos”
Reviews.Author: famtraveller7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is decorated nicely. Our room was large (junior suite) with a seperate bedroom and living room plus balcony. The staff was very efficient, courteous and helpful. A shuttle service was available to take you to the city center but, you do need to book in advance (highly recommended). If not, you can get a taxi pretty quick. The hotel is non-smoking.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in a frenetic city”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Travellor_9
Reviews.Content: We had looked at trip advisor before we went to this hotel so we expected it to be out of the centre. It's fair to say it was further away from the tourist zone than we expected but we feel this was a good thing as the nights were quiet and restful. The free shuttle service to the Spanish Steps made commuting easy but remember to book in advance with the reception desk as the bus has only 7 seats. The room we had was on the side of the hotel so had a very limited view from the window but it was spacious, clean and well furnished. The bathroom was also high spec and a good supply of quality products were available. The breakfast buffet was very good with plenty of choice; there was also a menu available if you required something different but this was at a reasonable cost. We found the staff very helpful, especially the reception staff who had a good knowledge of where to go and what to see. The barman was very friendly and as stated by another reviewer supplied some lovely olives with our drinks. If you are happy with an out of town hotel the Duke is an excellent base but be aware it is at least a 40 minute walk to the Spanish Steps from the hotel but if the shuttle is not available you can always experience a kamikaze taxi ride for about 15 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: carribeandreams
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a residental area of the city but they run a shuttle down to the tourist areas. The lobby is nicely decorated and the staff was great. The room had a bed room with a balcony that looked into some one's yard, a couch and small table with two chairs. The bed was typical European....like a rock! The bathroom was spacious and well done. The room was quiet. During our stay the hotel also housed a group of South African dignitaries which was interesting. The breakfast was a simple continental buffet. All in all...not a bad hotel but I don't think I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: amandalael
Reviews.Content: I thought the Duke Hotel was beautiful. The neighborhood is out of the way, but I thought it was better than being in the middle of the craziness of Rome. And it wasn't so far that you couldn't get around. They have a great shuttle service and Villa Borghese was within walking distance. In addition, if you walked around the neighborhood a little bit you realize that this is where real Romans live and there are many nice non-touristy spots to eat and drink. The subway is only a few blocks away and super easy to use. The staff at the Duke were extremely friendly. On our first night there, my husband and I sat in the bar and had a few glasses of wine. We were the only ones in there and the bartender was so friendly and funny. He gave us the most delicious olives we had on the entire trip. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who likes to spend time in areas that are not overrun with tourists and who like to blend in with the locals a little.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff made our stay in Rome most pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: Waiyeehawaii
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to retreat back to after a full day of exploration in the city's monuments. It's in a residential neighborhood north of the Villa Borghese. The hotel's shuttle service is great. When it's full, we just take a taxi, which is not too expensive. The room is well appointed with Etro toiletries. The service by the Front Desk team is simply superb! I would highly recommend this. Note - if you want to be "in the middle of things", this hotel will be a bit out of the way for you.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel in quiet location, with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: MandM65
Reviews.Content: We chose The Duke hoping that it would match the photos on its website. It did! Elegant, peaceful and luxurious it was well worth the short journey from the city centre. There are a few local shops, very little traffic and the neighbourhood is generally up-market. Maybe our decision to arrive from Fiumicino by public transport was crazy on a rainy night - the "200" metres from Euclide rail station is rather longer, uphill. (Incidentally travel on the short rail trip Flaminio to Euclide involves many stairs and steep steps into the rail cars.) Our welcome at The Duke was warm, the superior room very spacious, beds rather firm with wonderful linen. Breakfast was excellent, dinner likewise though quite expensive. The lounge is spacious and beautiful. We didn't take our laptop and there seemed to be no desktop PC for guests to use, which was a pity. The free shuttle is good, although one evening it left us waiting/wondering at the Rome pick-up point until we telephoned the hotel. We suggest take the Leonardo Express from airport to Rome Termini. A regular white taxi from there to The Duke costs about 15 euros. Avoid taxi touts who will offer you a bargain fare of 50 euros!! Eat a big breakfast, take a free apple from reception, buy a travel pass, be prepared for plenty of hilly walking and eat dinner in the hotel at least once. Our stay was really good, we would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “STAY TOTALLY RUINED BY THEFT WITHIN 15 MINS OF ARRIVAL”
Reviews.Author: rob040
Reviews.Content: Within 15 minutes of arrival my wallet was stolen from our room by a man who informed he needed to check the airconditioning. As our room was on the 5th floor, I would seriously question the security of this hotel before booking a stay there. The staff were helpful with regard to cancelling the credit cards and promptly taking us to the police station to report the crime. We were also given an upgrade, as we no longer felt comfortable in our allocated room. Location was a little out of the way from the centre but courtesy bus was very reliable and much needed. The hotel was very clean and rooms very comfortable. Thought given to extras such as bathrobe and slippers in the bathrooms. The staff were courteous at all times. The hotel itself was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, not ideal for late nights out”
Reviews.Author: Lebowski25
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, very clean. Great breakfast. The hotel is quite far out from the main tourist areas, but the free shuttle bus is a great service. The hours of the bus are 8.00 am to 10.00 pm and go every 45 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “probably not staying there next time”
Reviews.Author: Mar7ini
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in Rome. We liked the hotel, however, we're not sure we'd stay there again. Our main concern was the location of the hotel. Yes, they do offer a free shuttle service. But with some bad luck, the shuttle will leave without you and will keep you waiting for it for as long as you like. On the first night we booked it (the last shuttle which is 10pm), it simply left without us. We waited for almost 30 minutes before we called the hotel and asked what happened. We found out that the driver took someone else in our place, a couple who probably was late for the previous shuttle. And no, we weren't late, they simply left earier because the bus was full. They sent the guy back but it meant another 15 minutes of waiting in the parking lot. On the second night it almost happened again, as there was 1 person too much waiting for the shuttle. So had we come on time, they would have left without us but since we were there 10 minutes earlier we "got lucky"... We also regreted that the last shuttle to the hotel left at 10pm, which meant that we always had to control the time during the dinner. Sure, you can take the metro and then walk from Flaminio station but seriously, after 10-12h walking we did every day, we didn't feel like it. The taxi from the center to the hotel costs app. 15-20 Euros. So the shuttle was the best option, but we didn't like being so dependent from it. Other than that, the hotel was pleasant. We loved the breakfast, the delicious coffee, the fluffy, thick towels in the bathroom, the bed so huge you could get lost in it. The room was spotless and was cleaned every day. The marble bathroom was nice and large, I'm not a fan of the tub/shower combo though and disliked showering in the pretty narrow bathtub while touching that hanging cloth (well, at least it wasn't plastic) all the time. We booked a Superior Room and I really hoped for a normal shower. The water pressure was really good though. The TV didn't offer too many chanels, and for those whose Italian is not fluent only 2 or 3 news channels in English and French. I also had to get used to sleeping under the bedspread which in my eyes might be okay at home, but I really dislike it in hotels. Last but not least: our impression on the last day was that the only free things in this hotel are the breakfast (unless you want it in your room), the shuttle and the candy on the pillows. Everything else, from the WiFi (6 Euros per hour) through the mini bar to the shuttle to Fiumicino (65 Euros) is pricey. Getting an iron is not possible, you need to use the washing/pressing service of the hotel. We probably won't stay there again. The hotel is pleasant but we're sure that Rome offers many equally pleasant hotels that are much more central.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon heaven!”
Reviews.Author: CornishLulu
Reviews.Content: The Duke Hotel describes itself as ‘Your home in Rome’ and we were certainly made to feel very welcome during our stay. The hotel has beautiful public rooms, filled with antiques and paintings and our superior room was top notch too; plenty of space, a separate closet for our clothes and cases and good sized bathroom which was tastefully decorated with marble tiles. Our booking was for our honeymoon and the hotel definitely contributed to us having a trip of a lifetime in Rome. All of the staff (even our chambermaid!) spoke excellent English and were very friendly. The breakfasts were of a very high quality with plenty to choose from; a buffet of traditional cooked items with an Italian inspired twist of course, continental cheeses and cold meets, delicious freshly baked breads, a great choice of fruit, yoghurts, cereals and yummy pastries and cakes! The Duke’s breakfasts certainly set up for our busy days of sight seeing. We found the hotel’s Mercedes mini bus shuttle to be very convenient. We pre-booked each day and found the trips very entertaining thanks to our lovely driver Luigi. Although there aren’t any good places to eat or explore close to the hotel the free shuttle bus meant that the location wasn’t a problem and if anything was an advantage as the suburbs are very quiet and it was good to get away from the noise of the busy city. We would definitely stay at The Duke Hotel again and hope to return to rekindle memories on future anniversaries. We would also recommend pre-booking a transfer from the airport rather than trying to access public transport or chancing it with a taxi. We used www.airports-shuttle.com and a return trip was 80 euros which we thought was good value for a chauffeur driven executive car to collect us from the airport in style. If you’re passionate about ice cream you must visit Giolitti, via Uffici del Vicario, 40 which is close to the Pantheon. You can whet your appetite before you travel at www.giolitti.it

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special and out of the way”
Reviews.Author: NYC37
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great neighborhood but is a distance from the city center. The shuttle service they mention only holds 8 people and you must book well in advance. We waited 20 minutes for it to pick us up in the evening as it was late. It would be better to take the number 52 bus at the top of the hill, 5 minute walk. There is always some discussion as well when trying to book the shuttle if they have room for you. Just annoyance that one does not want to deal with when on vacation. Service is uneducated as to restaurants in their neighborhood or anywhere else. Good at the normal day to day stuff one would expect. Rooms are nice and clean with lovely balconies.
