Besides breakfast food is TERRIBLE!!! Look over your bill, I was charged for things I did not have from the bar as well as an extra 365 euros for a room night I had already paid for. They took it off the bill but was still unacceptable. I would not stay here again, there are much better hotels in the city center with grand lobbies and better services.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: caseybecks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 5 nights in the Duke at the end of August. It is a fab hotel just a 5 minute walk from Euclide train station (not a metro station). The hotel runs a regular shuttle bus to and from the Spanish Steps which is very convenient. The breakfast was really nice and the staff were all very helpful and friendly. The hotel is north of the Villa Borghese which is a must see (as is the Galleria) We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Chilly79
Reviews.Content: We went to The Duke Hotel for our honeymoon and thoroughly enjoyed the whole trip. Rome was amazing and the hotel was really good. We booked our holiday through expedia and all of the information and photos provided about the hotel were accurate. The rooms were confortable and very clean, breakfast was brilliant and all of the staff were very helpful and nice. Virtually all of the staff speak english so you have to wait until you get into Rome to practice your Italian! The one drawback was that it is a little out of the way, although it is in a residential area. We found that it was quite quiet and tended to eat out by the Spanish Steps as it was a bit more lively. However, it is only a short trip on the metro, and the hotel does offer a free bus service to and from the Spanish Steps. This would not stop us from staying at the hotel again and we would definitely recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: sean49
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in late July. It is a very nice and well kept property in a quiet neighborhood. You do need to get accustomed to scheduling the shuttle rides but once you get over that it is very manageable. I also recommend taking a 10-15 minute walk down the hill (you pass the supermercato street which is down hill 2 blocks and then a right turn). There is an inexpensive restaurant as well as a good wine bar, very, very fine gelato location, and good but more expensive/better restaurant at the base of the hill. Simon, an outstanding staff member, was kind enough to drop us at one eatery and speak to the manager to ensure fine service. Also recommend a drink off the lobby, the house Red was excellent and I was the recipient of several "stout pours" by the staff. Regardless of the genorosity of the pour, the drinks room is extremely civilized. The hotel is definitely on the quiet side and the staff is very professional. A minor complaint was we coudn't control the AC from our room and no matter how much the desk turned it up it never really got particularly cool.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: nidabl
Reviews.Content: The Duke Hotel is really a good choice in Rome. Our room (a standard room) was very clean and appealing, the bathroom is fantastic! There were robes and slippers provided, a nice little touch. You can either take the train and metro, the free shuttle bus or a cab to get into town, all good options - although I would either catch the shuttle bus (remember to book the shuttle bus at the front desk) or take the train - you save some money, and it's very convenient. Loved the breakfast - the restaurant is very elegant with a touch of luxury, and the waitors are very helpful and polite.Safe and pleasant residential neigbourhood! Rome is an amazing city, and you will have a calm and relaxing stay at the Duke. The distance to "downtown Rome" is a disadvantage, but if walking distance isn't very important to you, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place.”
Reviews.Author: Golben
Reviews.Content: We went here on our honeymoon and were pleased with most things: Positives: * Very nice room - the junior suite that is. * A very quiet neighbourhood. * Polite and professional staff. * Champagne for breakfast! * Great service with shuttle to and from Piazza di Spagna. It was needed and appreciated. Negatives were just som minor things: *When we were eating dinner the waitress acted very stressed and seemed to want us to leave as early as possible. * A REALLY overpriced minibar. I mean, a Coke for 4 Euro? Overall we were very satisfied with our stay and would recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, comfortable hotel, if you do not mind not being in the historic center.”
Reviews.Author: NYNYGIraffe
Reviews.Content: Myself, my husband and our eight year old son stayed at the Duke Hotel for one night at the very end of our trip to Italy this past July. We had stayed in a more centrally located hotel for the first two nights of our trip. However, my son felt that our room at the other hotel had been too dark (due to scaffolding), and he insisted that we needed to find a new hotel for our last night. Expedia was offering a terrific rate for a junior suite at the Duke Hotel, about which I had remembered reading rave reviews on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. The room was stylishly appointed, light, and very comfortable. The concierge booked us into a quite good restaurant in the neighborhood called Pagaroma. The shuttle bus transported us there for free. One thing that I quite liked about this restaurant was that the only tourists eating there that night seemed to be from the Duke Hotel. (I know this because we encountered most of them the next morning at breakfast.) Everyone else appeared to be real, live Romans who actually lived in the neighborhood. The next morning, the buffet breakfast was really good. My son was thrilled. At the first hotel, the buffet breakfast had not been included and, I had felt, not worth the splurge. We had eaten a perfectly nice breakfast in a cafe nearby, but it had been a big disappointment for him. The Duke Hotel does seem to be very child friendly. I think they must get quite a lot of families staying there. The suggestions for children's activities in their brochure were interesting -- a trip to the children's museum, bicycle riding in the Villa Borghese Gardens. The sort of activities I might recommend to a Roman family visiting Manhattan. My son definitely wants to stay there again next summer, but for longer. My husband would prefer to be nearer to the historic center where he can walk around. He had preferred the first hotel. I think that we might have to split it up again just to keep everybody happy. I should add that I assume that the reason that I was able to get such a good rate at the last minute was due to the fact that the location of the Duke Hotel is not ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Mineirim
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife went to The Duke Hotel, in Rome, really afraid about the location because we thought that it was too far from the historical center. But we had a great surprise. The hotel is great... we stayed in a beautiful suite with 02 LCD Tvs and a spacious bathroom. About the distance from the historical center: a car service every half hour to and from the historical center and the hotel is very close to the metro station... so, no problem with that. A special thing to register is the breakfast... the best one we had during the whole trip to Italy (more 04 hotels).... very nice, with a lot of fruits and options.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Duke!”
Reviews.Author: kevsback
Reviews.Content: We used the Duke as a base for a week in Rome to start our honeymoon and we couldn't have chosen a better hotel. Absolutely everything at this hotel was amazing - food, room, staff, cleanliness - not a single thing we could find fault with. We fell in love with the hotel and will definately be going back (don't let the fact that it's a little out of the centre put you off, the hotel run a FREE Mercedes shuttle minibus all day to and from the Spanish Steps). If you're looking for the perfect place to stay in Rome go for the Duke.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: genkhis_khan
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Duke and found it ideal for the needs of a family of 4 looking for a fairly high standard of comfort. We had an attractive and spacious room with a large balcony, with room for table and chairs - could easily have enjoyed a room service meal on it if we'd been so inclined. There was a large sofa bed for the children. The hotel's location, situated beyond the gardens of the Villa Borghese, was just a minor inconvenience. A regular complimentary shuttle bus will take you to and from a drop-off point within easy walking distance of the Spanish steps. The hotel restaurant is very pleasant for breakfast. We had dinner their one evening and were fed very well indeed but it is better to get out and about. The front desk were extremely helpful in giving us restaurant recommendations and reservations. We thoroughly enjoyed the places they recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not the perfect location for tourist, ok for the concert hall or rugby”
Reviews.Author: dottorsocrates
Reviews.Content: the reason why I booked this hotel is because I had to attend a party at the concert hall, which is 5 minutes away by cab, and it was the cheapest 4 stars (120€) Our room was quite small, but it was very clean and had quite a big bathroom if we had to compare it with the room itself. THe hotel looks brand new and I had the idea that also the restaurant was quite good from the menu I read but unfortunately I have not ate there. It has not the best location if you want go visit ROme as a tourist even if not far away there is a suburban train station where you can catch a train that brings you in the premises of Piazza del Popolo. On hte other hand if you are coming to attend a show, concert or rugby game in the Flaminio Stadium it has a very good location because the stadium is in walking distance (approx 10 min.) Even the new concert hall has the same distance. We went to the Hall by taxi because it was raining like hell otherwise we would have walked.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: julie05Winslow
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel late June 2008. The hotel is in a quiet residential area but if you are organised and book yourself onto the courtesy mercedes bus into Rome it isnt really a problem. We felt the hotel was wonderful....real attention to detail. The breakfast was perfect with anything you could possibly want. A large table full of fruit, cereals, cheese, bacon, eggs, danish pasties etc. By far the best thing about this hotel were the friendly, helpful staff. If I returned to Rome I would go back to this hotel without hesitation, we didn't want to come home!

Reviews.Title: “Well pleased with the Duke!”
Reviews.Author: leaderman
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 20+ travelers, part of a university alumni tour of Italy. Rome was our last stop of a 12 day tour, and our stay at the Duke was fabulous. We purposefully chose hotels away from the crowds in each of our stops - believing that it's good to be in the rush during the day when visiting the important sites, and shopping etc., but at night, we wanted for quality hotels apart from the "mob scene." Not only did the Duke fit that need, it fit the need beautifully, and with style. Rome is more than the Trevi Fountain and the Vatican.......to be lodged in a classy residential area allowed us to capture yet another essence of Rome - and we appreciated it very much. Rooms were elegant, food (breakfast) was great, and the front desk staff were among the finest. Gracious, helpful, happy - who could ask for more? Yes, one must plan to get back and forth from the hotel, but the cost is very much worth it. One small detail worth mentioning.....do not take a large tour bus to the Duke....it is nearly impossible to navigate the winding roads and avoid wiping out the hundreds of Smart Cars whose owners park them every which way along the path. On one occasion, we actually lifted a car out of our way.........much to the chagrin of our hosts!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: SGM68
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a quiet section north of the Villa Borghese/Borghese Gardens. Customer service was top notch (arrived at 10 a.m. after an overnight flight from the US and our room was ready), breakfasts were above average. Room was a bit small and bed was very uncomfortable but otherwise clean and appealing enough for the little time we spent there. As others have noted the shuttle fills up quickly so reserve your time well in advance. Otherwise you're stuck taking a taxi to the city center for 15 Euros per ride -- kind of pricey when you realize you need to multiply that by about 1.5-1.6 to get the cost in US Dollars -- and who wants to spend $60/day on taxis? Overall, a nice hotel but for the price I'd rather be in the center of the city.

Reviews.Title: “An Exceptional Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: GFAMelbourneVictoria
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel with great rooms and excellent facilites. Staff are very helpful. Breakfast was exceptional. Although out of the centre of Rome, we found this to be a benefit. The free shuttle bus allowed us to travel into the centre of Rome with minimal fuss. Close to restaurants and the train. Would recommend this hotel to anyone needing a quiet, spacious and clean hotel at very reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Maverick2008
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, situated a little out of the city centre in a residential area, with a free shuttle bus running approximately hourly, to a parking area near the Spanish Steps. The hotel was very clean and the room was larger than average, for a city hotel. The food, breakfast and evening meals, were excellent and all at a very resonable price. A great hotel for your base, when seeing the sights of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with very good customer service”
Reviews.Author: navstox
Reviews.Content: When we were researching hotels in Rome, it came down to staying the Duke hotel and a few other hotels in Central Rome. We are very glad that we finally decided to go with Duke! The hotel although a couple of miles from Central Rome - is AWESOME - the facilities, the cleanliness, the friendly staff and the shuttle service to Central Rome. We stayed there in the month of April and the room was a little hot - we were told that the AC could not be turned on until May (due to some law in Rome/Italy) - we opened the window and let the cool breeze in - it was just fine after that. We wish that there was a shuttle service to pick us up from the train station - coz the taxi drivers at Roma Termini were crooks asking us for 15 Euros per person when the total fare should have been not more than 10-12 Euros. The rooms was very well furnished, clean. Almost all of the staff served with a smile and were very helpful - right from carrying our bags to the rooms to giving us details about local attractions to having the shuttle etc. We would DEFINITELY RECOMMEND this place to all our friends/relatives who travel to Rome, Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan-Van-Loock
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with a very nice service, room where more than expected. Very kind and helpfull staff who gives information to make your stay even better. My stay in Rome was perfect due to the weather and the Duke hotel. Next time I come to Rome I already have an hotel to stay. Thanks to all the staf Charles Temmerman & Jonathan Van Loock

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: chideli
Reviews.Content: Very nice place, exellent staff and nice rooms. Thank's to Francesco not in the city center but was not a problem using shuttle bus. I will be back again

Reviews.Title: “Location - More than a mile from Centre”
Reviews.Author: ElleSwansea
Reviews.Content: The hotel was equal to its 4stars and the hotel reception staff were extremely helpful. However, we found the location was just too far out and we relied everyday on the hotel's shuttle bus, which you needed to book. Its a quiet hotel, so if your looking for lots of life in the bar, this isn't for you.

Reviews.Title: “A lovley hotel, I will definitely return to the welcoming Duke”
Reviews.Author: MarshaC
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Duke at the start of March for 3 nights. When we arrived we were greeted by very friendly concierge staff and shown up to our room. We had the standard classic room and I thought it was absolutely lovely, very large for the european continent. The room had a big comfy bed, flatscreen tv, fabuolous bathroom and bath, comfy dressing gowns etc. We had a package which included dinner on the first night and the meal in the restaurant was good but not the best meal i had in rome. The restaurant prices for food and drinks is also a lot more expensive than in central rome so we ate out the other nights. We did however have drinks in the hotel and also received a complimentary drink from the bar man which was a nice touch. The hotel is outside rome but I loved the fact that you could come back to the lovely chilled atmosphere of the duke after a busy day sight seeing. We also used the complimentary bus to the spanish steps which is a really good service. The Duke was a fantastic hotel and I will definitely stay there next time I visit the beautiful city of Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for Rome sight-seeing”
Reviews.Author: Bookworm26
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well outside the tourist run of Rome, and into domestic Roman life, complete with dogpooh competing with the recycling bins on the pavements, and little old men sitting in the bar near the hotel. Pluses: It is quiet, with not a lot of traffic noise. It is very nicely decorated, with our 'Classic' room a good size and certainly better value than other hotel rooms in the UK of the same grade that have cost more - but it was on the small size for a 4 star hotel room in Sydney. It was fitted with shutters, as well as curtains, and we were able to open the window for some fresh air. Sky TV was free, which was a bonus for my husband. The buffet breakfast was more than adequate to set us up for a day's sightseeing, with eggs, bacon, sausage, toast on request, cereal, fruit (fresh and preserved), yoghurt, and fresh juices, plus the full array of Italian pastries, croissants and salamis and cheese. Staff are very attentive. The bathroom was spotless, also with an opening window. The shuttle runs every 45 minutes or so down Via Ludovisi, and it's an easy walk down to Piazza Barbarini & the Metro. I imagine in Summer it would be very popular, and as it only holds 7 seats, bookings are essential. There is also the 52 bus which runs from behind Via Del Corso, & drops you at the top of Via Archimede. It's pretty crowded at the beginning but empties out towards the top. We took a taxi from the hotel to a restaurant on Viccolo Della Vacarella, in the Centro Storico & it was about €11, and a little less to come back again, as we picked a cab up at the rank just round the corner. Both drivers appeared to be surprised to get a tip. Staff were very friendly and spoke excellent English. They were very happy to book tours, taxis and whatever we wanted, and the restaurant tip we were given was also excellent. There is a small supermercato just up the hill a bit from the hotel to stock up on drinks & nibbles. Make sure you have some change, they get a bit niggly about changing €20 notes at the end of the day. Minuses: The hotel is not on a metro line, but instead you can change at Flaminio, then pick up the Roma-Viterbo Line & get off at Euclide, which is just at the botton of the hill the hotel is on. It's pretty easy & it's only one stop & it's also covered by your metro ticket. Despite the free map given out by the hotel saying they sold Metro tickets, they didn't have any & we had to wander down the hill to negotiate with the grumpy woman in the Tabacchi who didn't speak any English & had only the 75 minute tickets - good thing my Italiano was up to it, but be warned, she's not exactly charming. The room was overheated, but we were able to reduce the temperature by leaving the window open. One of our fellow guests came down & was a bit upset that he couldn't control the temperature himself, but the receptionist was very amenable about turning it down. The cost of items in the mini-bar is outrageous. See note about about the Supermercato up the hill. At the end of a long day, the walk back up to the hotel from Euclide is a bit of a drag, but there's no reason you couldn't get a bus, or a cab from town. Overall: I would be very happy to stay there again, but next time I'd go for a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “great people make for a great stay”
Reviews.Author: richlor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Duke Hotel in Rome for 4 nights and had a great experience primarily because of the staff. It is hard to overrate them...all of them! We had some early issues with our computer connection and they fixed them immediately; each and every person greeted us and catered to our needs in a way rarely seen anywhere in any service situation. The accommodations were perfect and they even changed our first room (as it didnt have the balcony we had asked for) without question. The breakfast was stellar, including fresh fruit and a wide variety of fresh pastries and hot and cold dishes. The Duke is a bit off the beaten path, but there is a shuttle which was always on time and which made it easier for us to get around the city and then return to this quiet enclave. We were in Rome but apart from the noise and craziness of the city. Yes, it takes a bit more planning, but it was well worth. We stayed in five hotels while in Italy and this ranked at the top. It is a smallish hotel, quaint but with the personal service to match.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Feenagh4
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely one of the finest I have ever visited! Not only was the service outstanding, but the rooms were large, by European standards, light and spacious and had absolutely everything one might need to make a vacation stay welcoming and comfortable. I booked through Expedia and did it months in advance. Being that it was my first trip to Rome (a vacation with a friend), I had little idea of what to expect. The Duke is NOT in the center of all of the hubub and noise which is one of the reasons I chose this hotel. As a result of location, it takes an extra ten minutes to get there, but is well worth it! From Termini, simply take a train to Flaminio, walk up and out of the station and turn right to go into the station for a local train to Piazza Euclide. It's one stop. Upon exiting the station at Piazza Euclide, turn left, pass the lovely restaurant on the left and turn left on via Archimede. Walk up the hill about half a mile and The Duke is on the left. We arrived mid-morning after nearly twelve hours of travel, schlepping our bags on the commuter rail into Boston, connecting to the airport via subway, then on to Philadelphia where we connected with an international flight direct to Rome. Upon arrival, we got a train from the airport to Termini, then took the Metro to Flaminio and then got a local train to Euclide and walked up the hill to The Duke. Although the room was not quite ready, the receptionist greeted us as though she expected our arrival, took us to a beautiful lounge and made sure we were comfortably seated while they finished making the room ready. It was well worth the wait! We had two lovely large windows looking out over terraces of other residences in one of the loveliest Rome neighborhoods. As well, the room had beautiful hardwood floors, windows that opened easily, a huge marble bathroom and a beautiful and large walk-ini closet. The beds were sheeted in white linen. There was a smalll, but very adequate television with multiple channels (for those interested in spending their time watching T.V. when there are so many more interesting things to do!), lovely bedside tables, a built in desk, an in-room safe, ample wooden hangers, chairs and terry robe with slippers for each occupant. It was immaculate, with every detail tended to. Soaps, lotions, tissues and towels were freshened and plentiful daily. The breakfast was absolutely wonderful with a wide variety of fresh fruit, baked goods, cereals, yoghurts, and eggs, cheeses and meat. Each morning we were treated to a pitcher of hot milk and two pitchers of fabulous coffee. By the second day, the wait staff knew who we were and what we preferred and were so attentive and kind. Tables are decked out with linen tablecloths and napkins and the buffet is picture perfect. Staff are attentive but don't hover. The meal was a welcome repast at that early hour and served to take us through much of the day as we walked miles and miles to see as much as we could in this remarkable and beautiful city. The staff were exceptional, from those who served at reception to concierge, to driving staff, to wait staff. All were very kind, most accommodating, highly professional and spoke excellent English. They helped with train schedules for the return trip to the airport, tour reservations for the Villa Borghese, the Ciao Roma bus tour (well worth taking if you have not been to Rome previously) and making change for us when we needed their assistance. Although we were very independent and used the train frequently, the van service to the Spanish Steps was great and we did use that a couple of times. You do need to reserve space, but we had no problems there and often were the only people riding (of course, it was February and not high season). There is a business center with a hotel desktop and printer. It was nice to have access to that in order to check plane reservations, print boarding passes and look up occasional tidbits. The connection was a bit slow, but adequate for our needs. All in all, I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Rome and looking for a place with class and service far above the norm. If I return, I will certainly stay there again as it was a real treat to return there at the end of each busy day, tired but satisfied, to relax and unwind in such comfort. If you have to be in the midst of the action, you might not want to stay here, but if you appreciate fine things, quality service, and a restful respite in a lovely part of town, this is a great find!

Reviews.Title: “What A Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Howthdublin
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit (as a couple!) to Rome and didn't really know where to locate ourselves - we read reports about the Duke on the internet and decided to go with it... we were not disappointed - its a little gem! The staff are extremely friendly and helpful and will go to no end to assist you. The location may appear to be a bit off the beaten track - but its close enough to get a wonderful walk through the Villa Borghese, a wonderful oasis. The courtesy bus is efficient and we didn't have a problem walking or taxi-ing back. The rooms are a good size, very clean and peaceful - and the bath rooms are wonderful - a huge bath to soak the aching bones after walking through this wonderful city - we will recommend the Duke to all our friends - an added bonus to all rugby fans - many of 6 nation teams stay here when playing against Italy... take our advice go and enjoy....

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Archie44
Reviews.Content: I and a girlfriend stayed at this hotel for our annual girly city break. Whilst not centrally located, it was easily accessible from the Airport via train and foot. The reception was friendly and efficient and our twin room was spacious, clean and well appointed. The hotel in general was very clean and very well presented and the staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was excellent and plentiful and the drinks service in the lounge during the evening was extremely civilised and accomodating. The shuttle service was more that adequate for the independant traveller and easily booked. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. During our stay in Rome we visited a number of 4 and 5 star hotels for morning coffee, afternoon tea and cocktails, but came away with the impression that the Duke was the best, apart from its location. If you want all the tourist attractions on your doorstep, then this hotel is not for you. But, if you are willing to travel 10minutes into the centre then it is well worth the effort. We will certainly return to this hotel and have promised the guys that we will take them next time!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Duke Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: shirleydpeters
Reviews.Content: We were well pleased with the hotel accomodations. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was included in our price and we found it to be a pleasing experience each time we dined there. Everyone spoke English and that was a definite plus as we could have had a really bad time if they had not. The area surrounding the hotel was nice and we could walk to several eateries etc. It was also quiet and peaceful in the busy town of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: javajeninga
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duke and had the most wonderful service there. We lost our luggage the first 2 days and they were exceptional at trying to get it back to us. The room was clean, a nice size and very classy. Being in the suburbs it was also very quiet at night. The only issue would be that it is a bit out of the way from the heart of Rome - but they have a free shuttle and there is a train station 5 minutes down the road. The morning breakfast was included and was very tasty and fresh. Again, the service was outstanding and that is what makes this place a great hotel to stay at. Special thanks to Manilla at the front desk for her determination to find our luggage, Alessio at the front desk for his accurate directions and details. Luigi for getting us safely to and from the hotel and his great sense of humor. Alessio and Francesco for great service in the dining area. Highly recommend this hotel if you can manage it being a little off the beaten path.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome, Stay at the Duke!”
Reviews.Author: GotTheBugAgain
Reviews.Content: A beautiful, relaxing, classy hotel. This was our first trip to Rome and it was wonderful! We arrived early in the morning, and we only had to wait a short while while our room was prepared. These folks know the importance of sleep! Once we went to Sweden and arrived early in the morning and they wouldn't let us check in until after noon-we walked around like zombies and when we finally did check in we slept all day! Not at the Duke. We were able to get in a nice nap and be up by noon to spend our first day in Rome. The room was very spacious and beautifully appointed; spotlessly clean. The bathroom was wonderful with great amenities and lots of room. And we certainly didn't expect turn-down service, but we got it! Towels replaced and everything! The complimentary breakfast was great! Try the cheese and red cabbage. They had a business center where we could check email without a hassle. The doorman, the folks at the front desk, housekeeping...everyone was cheerful and polite. They have a shuttle to the city, but we didn't use it because we always had to take a taxi to meet up with the kids in different areas of Rome but on our next stay we will definitely use the shuttle. I can't say enough good things about the Duke. One word of warning: if you are using a taxi, make sure to memorize the shortest route back to the hotel because we got ripped off twice by drivers; one who claimed he didn't know where the hotel was and got lost (even though he had gps) and another who should have been a tour guide as he took the longest and most circuitous route ever. Anyhow, hats off to The Duke. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: andrewmaiden
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights commencing on 29th October 2007 and found the hotel faultless. The superior double room was spacious and there was considerable attention to detail. It was kept spotlessly clean throughout our stay and we found it good value for money.The shuttle bus was always on time and the staff were extremely helpful for example in recommending local restaurants or transport options for sigtseeing further afield. Nothing was too much trouble for them. Excellent breakfast, but the restaurant food did seem expensive. We look forward to returning in the future. Andrew & Liz Maiden

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: openwork
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duke Hotel for 5 nts in Sept and can honestly say it's one of the best hotels we have stayed in. The hotel staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. We had booked 2 twin rooms for ourselves and 2 sons (all Citalia had at time of booking) but when we checked in we requsted a Family room (interconnecting rooms) ; "no problem" they said; this applied to anything we asked of them. They arranged early breakfasts, packed breakfasts, loaned umbrellas when it rained (fortunately this was only once). The staff on reception were exceptionally helpful and very friendly. The rooms were lovely: clean, very comfortable and quiet: beautiful bathrooms and toiletries. The buffet breakfast was excellent - what a choice- cereals, toast, rolls, pastries, cakes, fresh fruit salad, cheese, cold meats, eggs and bacon, fresh juices, a fruit bowl and a variety of tea and coffees. The Duke is only 10 min from Rome, in a very quiet residential area, which was great after the hustle of the City (you need a good nights sleep after all the walking). The hotel have a courtesy mini bus which runs every 45 min to and from the city (Spanish Steps). We fell in love with Rome and are plannning a return trip asap. We will definitely stay at the Duke again, but this time book directly with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: AdrianaMG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duke last week for our honeymoon and we were blown away by the amazing service! All of the staff was extremely friendly and so helpful. The maid service was prompt and kept our room very clean. We especially loved how special they made us feel. One afternoon while we were relaxing in our room, a bell hop brought us a complimentary plate of delicous fruits to enjoy! The hotel is a bit far out of the center of town but their shuttle service was very convenient and always prompt. Plus it was so nice to come back to a nice quiet and safe neighborhood. There was even a huge grocery store and some great restaurants nearby. (You must try Art and Fingerfood)The only thing I wouldn't recommend was the hotel restaurant for dinner unless you like fancy styled food. But their breakfast was great! It saved us a lot of money and we started out the day with full bellies. Our room was the perfect size for two and the shower had great waterpressure! This hotel made our trip an extremely enjoyable one!

Reviews.Title: “Exceed our expections”
Reviews.Author: bajajohn
Reviews.Content: We read many reviews of this property and I must say most were very accurate. We had a double standard room which was very large in comparison to other rooms we stay at in Italy. The bath room was very nice and the room was well furnished. We knew about the location and like the location away from the center of the city. They have a suttle that takes you to and from the spanish steps. We didn't use it to return in the evenings but the taxis fare was only 10 to 15 euros. The hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful and the breakfast was outstanding. This may not be the hotel for everyone because of the location but for the money it's great. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “i wouldnt stay ther agiang”
Reviews.Author: LisaOakland
Reviews.Content: The hotel is NOT in the historical center of the city. It is in residential area. You cannot walk anywhere you should take very expensive taxi. They first room they gave it to me had a smell. I asked them to change the room and the second room was fine but small and kind of old. I brushed my teeth with light off because the light was connected to the fen and the fen was very loud. However, the staff is nice and breakfast is very good. I think this hotel is overpriced. I paid around $350 per nigh in July.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great staff and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Sun_travellerToronto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Duke Hotel, Rome during the first week of September. The hotel is very clean, bed sheets are changed daily, the room floors are clean shiny hardwood and the bathroom although a little small by North American standards had a tub with shower, bidet, single sink and after bath housecoats. The buffet breakfast is included for all hotel guest and this was always a nice mix of cereal, fresh fruits, various types of coffee, eggs, bacon, sausages. White tablecloth service was standard and a great start to the day. Dinner is available in the evenings, however prices were high and the ambiance was less attractive. Our suggestion is to have your evening meal elsewhere. The hotel has a shuttle car to take you to the Spanish Steps. The shuttle should be booked at least an hour ahead of time which worked our fine for us. The shuttle will also pick you up at the end of the day and the driver was always on time. All the drivers are a pleasure to be with. Front desk staff was always helpful and spoke English well. We took day trips to Capri and Florence and they kindly arranged these tours. The tour bus came right to the hotel to pick us up. There are many restaurants within a 15 walk from the hotel but nothing really close by. The room cost was very reasonable compared to other Rome hotels and the hotel is truly striving to be a 4 star hotel. We highly recommend it for those who don’t mind being a little out of the way.

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: parmagiana
Reviews.Content: I have just returned back to the U.S. after another superb stay at The Duke Hotel in Rome. I think it's simply the best hotel in Rome in terms of value and sheer elegance. Two years ago I stayed at The Duke for a month because of business. I was treated like a family member. Last week I was again called to Rome on business and the choice of hotel was simple...The Duke. The staff is quite good; friendly, efficient, and warm. No request is too big. Just ask and they deliver. The general manager, Mr. Daniel Terranova, oversees all operations with a discriminating eye for detail. He is often seen behind the desk or walking through the lobby to make sure his guests are well cared for. This refined and friendly gentleman is a treasure of information if you are seeking recommendations about experiencing performing arts or fine dining, not just in Rome but throughout Italy. His hotel is spotless and state-of-the-art. The rooms are large, bright and airy. The bathrooms are well equipped and modern. If you're here on business you can purchase blazingly fast wireless internet access for a small fee. The rooms are now equipped with beautiful flat screen TVs. (the are some English channels as well as pay per view movies) The breakfast (included in the room charge) offers a huge selection for any taste. The restaurant offers delicious fare for lunch or dinner. The spacious and elegant Polo Lounge is a great place to unwind for a quiet drink. The neighborhood is very quiet and relaxing. Restaurants are a short walk away. A taxi into the heart of Rome (Piazza Navonna) is a 15-minute, 10-Euro trip. The area is also serviced by Roman buses or the subway is nearby. The Villa Borghese is a pleasant walk from the hotel. I really can't say enough about the place or it's hospitality. When in Rome do as I do....do The Duke!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at the Duke Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pack-N-fly-N-play
Reviews.Content: The Duke Hotel was a wonderful and spacious place for our family vacation in Rome. We booked the Junior Suite which gave us ample room for my husband and I and our two preschool children. We did do our homework and read several reviews prior to our visit and so we were not surprised by the distance from the Hotel to the city center. Booking the shuttle was useful and taxis were another necessity. Surprisingly, several taxi drivers needed prompting on the hotel location - including our airport driver. So, if you are looking for a more affordable 5-star hotel, this is it. Just be prepared to take some of your savings and put it to use on your transportation. You'll still come out ahead. Room details - Really great bathroom getting top marks from our kids as the highligh of the trip. Two plasma TV's with SpongeBob in english if you spend enough time to convert the language. Comfortable king-size bed and very nice furnishings. Food details - The European style breakfast included selections that catered to many travelers - meats, cheese, eggs, fruit, yogurt, pastries, and cereals which included cocoa krispies. We also ate dinner one evening at the mostly empty restaurant. The food was excellent but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home at the Duke Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dionnewarner
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at the Duke Hotel the morning of June 29th at 8am. We received a warm welcome from the amazing and wonderful staff that we would get to know during our stay. The staff were eager to help us with sites to see and how to find them. The Duke hotels location is excellent as you are not far from anything and they have a shuttle service available if you wish. We enjoyed our buffet breakfast every morning before heading out to see the sites and once again the restaurant staff were excellent at making sure we were always okay. Our room was an nice size with room for us and our suitcases to move around comfortably. We always enjoyed a night cap at the bar every evening and or bartender was always willing to try and make something new for us. My husband and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Rome. We look forward to returning to the Duke Hotel and exploring more of Roma. To the staff at the Duke Hotel thank you for making our stay a pleasant one. Sincerely Dionne and Graham Warner

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Suziewba
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Duke four times now, twice as a couple and twice with our 3 children. We would not stay anywhere else in Rome. Large, confortable rooms and reliable, friendly, professional service. Transfers, concerts, galleries all booked without a hitch, including locations outside Rome and after we checked out! Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect ambience”
Reviews.Author: TorontoParadiso
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel away from the city centre in a lovely residential neighbourhood.Boutique style with well appointed rooms and bathrooms.Helpful staff and service.There is a regular shuttle bus into town.The hotel restaurant has a limited menu but excellent service.Breakfast is good with both hot and cold options.I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for Rome trip”
Reviews.Author: TripTraveller2007
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 days in Rome, having stayed at 'The Duke'. From the moment we stepped out of the private car from the airport (which The Duke reception arranged for us by email prior to leaving the UK) everyone was just fantastic ! Everyone on reception was friendly, polite and very professional, but this also applied to any of the hotel staff that we met. The room was excellent very spacious and extremely clean.The bathroom had everything you would expect with a nice powerful shower to wake you up after a great nights sleep. I would say that the location of The Duke is one of it's best strengths. When you get back to the hotel you were guaranteed a good nights sleep due to the hotel's location and compfortable bed. As people have mentioned there is an excellent shuttle bus service (usually driven by Luigi, a very nice friendly guy) and should generally be booked the day before Tip 1: We used to always get the shuttle bus into the main area each day, but would always get a taxi back to the hotel. This meant that you could keep costs down, but you did not have to rush back to meet the shuttle bus if you were accross town. A taxi was approx 10 euro from most areas of the town to the Duke Tip 2: Piazza Navona is a great place to go in the evening, with an excellent choice of restaurants to choose from (approx 10-15 minutes walk from the Spanish steps) Tip 3:Try the ice cream from one of the 'Blue Ice' parlours ! In summary I would highly recommend The Duke to anyone, and would not hesitate to go back there when we return to Rome !

Reviews.Title: “40th Birthday Trip”
Reviews.Author: AndrewQuinn
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome after 4 days in this hotel. Our stay was excellent, even though the hotel is a lttle way out of the centre, the shuttle bus is an excellent service. The room we had was a Superior Room and it was fantastic. The bathroom had a seperate shower and bath, with an over bath shower. There were two sinks and all of the extras you would expect. Very spacious rooms, and the staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfasts were very good and the Bar/Lounge area was very comfortable. This is an excellent base for anyone visiting Rome, make use of the shuttle service, its very convenient and very reliable. We are planning to visit Rome again next year and I would not look anywhere else for the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jjosey
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, comfortable, excellent breakfast and the staff was superior to any hotel that we have stayed at in Europe (we've lived here for 6 years and have seen alot of Europe). The free shuttle service more than made up for the distance from the center of all of the tourist attractions. Make sure you book the evening before and you won't have trouble getting a seat on the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: teddyUsa
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for a week at the Duke Hotel. The service was excellent - the concierge went out of their way to ensure that we had a good experience with them. The hotel offers a shuttle to the Spanish Steps in the city center, which turned out to be something we took advantage of more than we would have imagined. Very convenient - the only drawback is that it stops running at 10pm, so if you're staying in the city later than that, you'll have to take a cab back to the hotel. The room was very clean, and well maintained. Not much of a view from the hotel, but we didn't care since we were only there to sleep. The hotel restaurant prices seemed VERY expensive, so we don't recommend planning on eating there for dinner. They offer a free breakfast, which had all the regular continental breakfast items, plus eggs, bacon and sausage. However, these tasted awful, so we only took advantage of the free breakfast by getting cappicinos there. Last thing to note - definitely check your mini bar in your room to make sure that everything is OK. We didn't see until the third night that someone had already drank two of the mini bottles, and had placed them back in the fridge. The concierge was very understanding, and made sure that we weren't charged for it, but you should make sure to check this first anayway. Overall - great experience. We would definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Duke - can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: kelly4Philadelphia
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five night stay at the Duke Hotel and had an absolutely wonderful experience!! The rooms were all spacious, extremely clean, well-maintained, and beautiful - we booked 2 jr. suites and 1 superior room for our extended family of 8 including young children. The public space of the hotel was just as impressive. The entire staff was extremely professional, friendly, and considerate. The manager, Daniel, and the front desk staff really went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. They also had wonderful suggestions for restaurants for us. The location was perfect. We were in a very nice, quiet, safe neighborhood near parks. We were close enough to all the city's big attractions, yet not overwhelmed by the noise and the crowds. We took advantage of the wonderul shuttle service which took us to yummy local restaurants and a beautiful church. We enjoyed a delicious breakfast every morning - much heartier than we expected at a European hotel. A gem of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelFunSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Top Notch Hotel with really great service. Jr Suite was spacious with a huge marble inlaid bathroom. Free Shullte service to Spanish Steps area Daily. More that fair price. Not within walking distance to any tourist attractions but can be overcome with the free shuttle )must make reservations at the front desk for the free shuttle). Free breakfast was really nice buffet and made to order eggs + ommelets plus staff willing to make early breakfast or boxed breakfast without extra charge if you want to leave before 7 am. Front desk staff can arrange for group or private tours of many tourist attractions (if you want a private tour, make reservations well in advance). Dining room had a nice menu with great food and AWESOME service plus they had a kids menu which was nice (expect resort type prices). Live piano music in the loung after 7 pm. (The loung is HUGE, I would recommend just relaxing there and having a drink or a glass of wine in the evening.) My family played cards and games while listing to the piano for over 2 hours one night and is was a really nice change to the "go go" of seeing all of the tourist attractions. Expect to pay 8 - 12 Euros for a family of 4 to and from tourist attractions and restraunts if you don't use the shuttle. If you want primo service and accomidations this is the place to stay. I enjoyed my stay and would be confident to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “An Enjoyable Stay ath the Duke Hotel, Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jordi25
Reviews.Content: Rome: Duke Hotel - An Enjoyable Stay Date: May 3, 2007 A wonderful hotel that is well maintained, with a friendly and attentive staff. My wife and I arrived early and while the room we were to be given was not ready, they switched us to another room without hesitation. The superior room we had was very spacious and comfortable. The breakfast was quite good. The only problem we had was with some ants that came into the bathroom from the windowframe -- the room had a balcony. When advised of the problem, the staff quickly took care of it. Location is a minor drawback because of the distance to the sights of Rome. The hotel does provide a free shuttle service (which needs to be reserved early as it only has 8 or 9 seats), while taxis can be a couple of minute to 15 minute wait. A bus stop is a three minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel Off the Beaten Path”
Reviews.Author: PaisanoPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a residential area. Room amenities were upscale and comparable with a four star hotel in the U.S. Our room was immaculately clean and bathroom, while smaller than U.S. Standards for hotels of this level, were extremely well appointed. The bed, made up matrimoniale style, was firm and very comfortable, with very high quality bed linens and pillows. Lighting in the room was excellent and easy to use. The closet was the nicest we saw on our Italy trip, large with plenty of hangers and drawers, and a safe. The front desk was extremely atttentive and helpful with restaurant reservations, taxis and even directions to church. . Some people might consider the hotel's location in a residential neighborhood north of the Villa Borghese (Rome's Central Park) to be a drawback. We had a 20 minute walk to one of the few restaurants in the area. On the other hand, the hotel is in a quiet area, away from the noise of central Rome, and the hotel provides free shuttle service to the Spanish Steps area, so you are never far from the action. We did not have a meal at the hotel but the bar and dining areas appeared to be quite elegant, and a piano player was in the bar. We would highly recommend the hotel for travelers who want some peace and quiet in an elegant setting.

Reviews.Title: “Really really good”
Reviews.Author: sasUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Duke mid May 2007 for our anniversary weekend. Overall, we had a really lovely stay there. The staff were the biggest plus point for me. They were incredibly helpful and could not do enough, without even being asked. They spoke great English and provided us with lots of information. It seems like a hotel which really cares about its reputation and ensuring its guests have a great time. We had a meal at the restaurant which was reasonably priced and really enjoyable. The breakfasts were also great and had lots for vegetarians like myself. In terms of the room, this has everything that you need, and for us also had the benefit of a quiet location (which after you visit Rome City Centre, you will appreciate!) We also had a balcony which was lovely. In terms of things for improvement, there is one suggestion we would make. The hotel is situated around 15/20 minutes drive away from town and the frequency and availability of the courtesy shuttle bus at busy times (ie morning and late afternoon) should really be improved. It only has 7 seats and this will clearly not be enough for the Hotel at busy periods. However, we travelled back and forth into town many times and only had to get a taxi on one occasion, so if you booked ahead, you would probably be ok. Also, a tip if you go to stay there - they should make sure that you know a lot of the TV channels which are in Italian can be changed to English very simply using the remote control - took us a while to figure that out, and before that all we had was news. I really would recommend this hotel. You'll have a lovely stay. Just remember to plan your days and book the shuttle bus in advance. Would be even better if frequency of bus was improved at peak times.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - thoroughly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Setterhouse
Reviews.Content: Delightful hotel! The hotel itself is easy to get to and benefits from being just outside of the centre of Rome. Our room was lovely and the bathroom even better and very well equipped. The choice at breakfast was excellent and the staff were always on hand to take your order. In the evening, the bar was also run very efficiently and it was lovely to have some mini choc ices served with a perfect brandy. There was a lot of attention to detail from the fresh flowers to the decorators refreshing the paint work and everyone was genuinely pleased to help you - nothing seemed too much trouble. We used the hotel courtesy shuttle bus to go into Rome in the afternoons and evenings but the rest of the time were very happy to use the local train station - an 8 minute walk from the hotel - and then one stop and you are at the Flaminio station close to the Piazza Del Popolo. The staff were extremely helpful and Alexandro on the reception desk booked our restaurants for us and we were absolutely delighted with the results. Very happy to recommend the hotel and in fact my brother and his wife have booked in for the end of July.

Reviews.Title: “Super Second Honeymoon at the Duke!”
Reviews.Author: mhc1988
Reviews.Content: The Duke is a small, privately owned boutique hotel near the stadium, in the Parioli section of Rome. We cannot say enough about this wonderful, quiet, beautiful hotel and its' staff. The airlines lost our bags for 2 days, and the Duke was kind enough to upgrade our room to a larger one with a balcony, as a special gift! Personalized service and a helpful staff also abound here.We had 2 days of early touring, and the kindly concierge took pity and made us cappuchino himself , at 6:15 a.m.THe front desk arranged the free shuttle to the Spanish Steps with no problems for us several times, and also arranged a tour of the Sistine Chapel. The restaurant was first class, a real gourmet treat for a special dinner.The morning breakfast had everything from local pastries, parma ham, fruit and rolls, as well as American eggs, bacon , and sausage. Cabs to and from the sights in Rome ran 10-14 euros (13-18 dollars) for two people.We walked alot from the Spanish Steps, and took cabs or the shuttle back at night.Overall, a super experience and our first in Rome.We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfetc stay!”
Reviews.Author: loveyoudaddy
Reviews.Content: I would like to recommend this Hotel to everyone is looking for a dream inside a dream:The Duke Hotel is the best you can find to live in a dream called Rome! Excellent room,great Hotel and above all this ( which could be enough to appreciate it ), wonderful Staff and Management : fun to have a Rossana candy and a red apple at the Reception Desk! We felt to be like the only Guests of the Hotel because Mr. Terranova and his great Staff took care of us in each moment of our stay, hard to succeed if you consider it was almost fully booked for Eastern Holidays. I've been there with a friend and her 1 month aged child David and everyone has been so kind to us in offering the best help whenever needed, quite prompt for everything with unexpected kindness we did really appreciated. Large and quite comfortable room, perfect bed where to sleep and dream and clean- like- a -mirror bathroom,too. Very good breakfast with high level service and nice to have a drink at the Polo Lounge with piano music player.The Hotel is located in the Parioli area, not downtown but quiet and smart , probably the best part of Rome.No problem to get downtown because you find a free Shuttle-Bus Service from the Duke to Piazza di Spagna and back all day long available. Mr. Terranova is so polite and to meet him is a delicious experience. Thanks to him ,we got the chance to stay there one day longer. Hope to go back to Rome as soon as possible, I can affirm that I found home far from home at The Duke: not going to look for any other place in Rome for my next trips.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent Hotel for a short visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: TunbridgeWellsKent
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is excellent for a short stay. We are a family of 4 and stayed for 3 nights in April 2007. Our two rooms were very good. The staff are very friendly and this was evident when at check-in we were first allocated rooms on different floors. However, the Manager quickly gave us two rooms on the same floor even though we didn't ask. The Hotel is just outside central Rome, but this is compensated by the efficient free shuttle service. There is an overland train station Euclide just 5 minute gentle walk from the Hotel. The Metro station Flaminio ( Piazza Del Popolo ) is just one stop from Euclide and the cost is just € 1.00 each way. Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain are only 5-6 minutes walk from Poplolo. A 20 minute walk to the Vatican, but you get the benefit of seeing Roman life. Overall the Hotel is ideally situated away from the hustle of busy central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Base for Exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: NJLondon
Reviews.Content: The Duke is located just out of central Rome and although there is no nearby metro to take you to the attractions, the hotel has an excellent shuttle service which we had no problems in booking. Otherwise do what the locals do and take the bus which is very easy and its a great way to see Rome cheaply. Bus no. 901 goes to Termini and no. 52 to west part of the city. We had no difficulty in getting back to the hotel from the south bank after 11pm. The staff all spoke excellent english, were friendly and always happy to suggest restuarants and give travel advice. Rooms were clean and well decorated and the general standard was more than a 3+star hotel. We stayed for 3 nights in March and would recommend the Duke for a quite stay, where standard of accommodation is an important consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Duke Hotel has the advantage......”
Reviews.Author: KJWEssex
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at the Duke Hotel in Rome. The hotel is excellent and is much more grand than its rating suggests and I would thoroughy recommend it. The staff are friendly and attentive and very willing to help and we felt very welcome during our stay - and they also speak good English! The restaurant is very very good as is the facility of the adjoining large lounge with evening pianist. Found the Superior rooms on the 5th floor were spacious enough. Unfortunately, we were allocated a room with a double bed instead of the required twin beds but this was remedied by 2 willing maids who appeared literally within minutes to remedy ( - but more likely to be the fault of Expedia who got most other parts of the holiday wrong too. Certainly would never use Expedia again!) Being some way out of town has the enormous advantage of peace and quiet and a good nights sleep in a pleasant residential neighbourhood with an excellent self service breakfast - and the efficient free shuttle service into the centre of Rome and back every hour adequately compensates for any inconvenience of not being in the centre of town. Having seen the location of many of the other Rome hotels during our stay we would have no hesitation in going back to the Duke Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bella Roma”
Reviews.Author: Hatjoug
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at the Duke Hotel for four nights in March (23 to 26). It is hard to fault the experience. The service is as good as it gets before becoming intrusive. English is spoken.The little restaurant is excellent and only moderately expensive (though we failed to communicate our order correctly on both occasions that we ate there). The hotel is very clean and well decorated and has a very relaxed ambience. The only drawback is location. If you like to drift back and forth to the hotel intraday it is not really practical. The shuttle bus is usually booked at the best times and getting to the pick up point after a days sightseeing is not appealing. We resorted to Taxis which adds around 25 euros each day. However, the hotel is such good value in other respects that this is not enough to stop us staying there again. As for Rome, it is an amazing place. Take a very comfortable pair of shoes and take your time. Even the two-hour queue for the Vatican is worthwhile once you reach the Cistine Chapel.

Reviews.Title: “We Recommend the Duke”
Reviews.Author: Haroula
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Duke Hotel for six days in Feb. I had read the reviews of the this hotel before booking and can affirm that most of the opinions are sound. The advantage of the distance to the city centre is the pristine clean air, absence of traffic noise and the sounds of many songbirds in the morning. (We kept our windows open .) I will list both what we enjoyed and also what the downsides were . The breakfasts were delightful with lots of hot dishes, many pastries , juices etc. It was a bargain to have this with the price of the room. The public sitting area was palatial and I read the paper there each morning after breakfast. On two occasions we made it back for afternoon tea and had it there as well. The beds were much harder than the ones you might be used to in America but I slept very soundly each night after a full day of sightseeing. I was Very diappointed to find on arrival that we were given a king sized bed even though we had been promised twin beds by email. It was do-able but really ! Their explanation was that a king was composed of two doubles sharing a common headboards. The linen sheets were lovely to sleep in but the room was very hot and temperature was very difficult to regulate from both the roon and the desk computer. We kept the windows open and this worked out for us. The plug in the bathtub did not work ( maintenance came to try) and so after the first night we had showers only. We would have like the occasional bath but we could live with it. The shuttle bus was brilliant and we used it to go to the closest metro or taxi stand each day. The staff are a delightful team of young people who do their very best to please , The management has chosen very well. If you go during the busy season I understand that there may be a lineup for the shuttle so walk downhill to the nearest taxi stand and take it from there. We called a taxi Twice to the hotel and it did not cost us any more to have it done this way. They come in a matter of minutes. In conclusion aside from the small items I mentioned the stay was a comfortable and enjoyable one. (If you are staying in Rome for a long time consider a train trip to Florence for the day. Hop on a double decker and view the city. Train is 1 1/2 hours in duration and runs each 1/2 hour.)

Reviews.Title: “The Duke is our favorite!”
Reviews.Author: FCS
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in November at the Duke and loved it. The staff was very attentive to all of our needs. Having stayed previously at the Hotel Del Senato which is next door to the Pantheon, we much prefer the Duke for its location, away from the crowds. The neighborhood was perfect for our needs. We'll definitely return to the Duke.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but bad location”
Reviews.Author: Peynet78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights in the Duke Hotel in February. The hotel location is in the “Parioli” quiet area but is not located in a central touristic area, so you need to take taxis. The hotel is perfect if you want be closed to the theatre of the music “Auditorium Parco della Musica” but if you want be closer to the center of Roma is not good. The hotel had only one courtesy shuttle van to the centre but you must request to reserve through the reception and the van has a maximum capacity of 6 people. Our room was a deluxe (n° 618 at the 6° floor). Be careful, choose the deluxe room because the superior are small and ask rooms in high floors because the room at 1° and 2° floor have a bad view. We know it because we stayed in Duke hotel in October 2002 too for one night and our room was the number 212 in 2° floor (superior room very little). In general the staff was friendly. The breakfast buffet is good. Be careful, if you go to the theatre and coming back you want to eat a sandwich in the bar of the hotel this is not possible after 11 p.m. You can eat a sandwich only in your room. So if you stay in this hotel with some friends, like we did, every people must eat alone in his/her room. So apart the night of the concert, to have dinner we went downtown. We stayed in Trattoria “da Armando al Pantheon” very good food and not expensive, we paid euro 64,80 for two people. The other restaurant was “La Buca di Ripetta”. When we stayed in the hotel there was a meeting. This was a problem because the lounge area was occupied of people of the meeting and for the normal clients was not possible stay and drink something. Fortunately this meeting was only the first day, so the second day we did not have problems. The hotel had a garage and the cost was euro 20.45 for day. Maybe if we decided to come back to Rome probably we will choose another hotel closer to the centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and a lovely introduction to Rome!”
Reviews.Author: RozoNYC
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 night stay at The Duke. It is a great hotel with the best staff I've ever encountered - super helpful, professional, and friendly! They all genuinely seemed to enjoy meeting and helping people. The staff really made our first visit to Italy terrific! The hotel truely looks like the pictures you see on the web and in their promotional materials. You really know what you are getting. Loved the beautiful marble bathroom and the robes. The breakfast buffet is excellent (Italian meats, cheeses, eggs, pasteries, fruits, cereals, yogurts, and juices/coffees/teas, as well as made-to-order perfectly-sized omlettes) - yum! Dinner and dessert were also very tasty :-) Location - set in a very quiet and safe residential neighborhood away from the main part of the city it is a welcome change to the hustle and bustle. The shuttle bus (7 person max.) to/from the Spanish Steps is very helpful, just remember to reserve in advance. Another great option is to use the public transportation system. Walk downhill about 3 blocks to Piazza Euclide and take the train 1 stop to Flaminio where you can transfer to the main subway system OR instead take a bus - the #52 travels on the same street as the hotel or the #910 from Piazza Euclide to the Termini Station (the main transportation hub). Weither you want to ride the bus or train, just remember you have to first buy a ticket (1Euro for 1 ride or 4 Euros for an all day ticket from the station at Euclide or from the tabacchi (tabacco shop) down the street). However, buses in the evenings aren't that reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Bella Roma, nadine, chicago”
Reviews.Author: Poupee07
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a trip to Rome and stayed at the Duke Hotel. The hotel is not located in a central tourist area, so you need to taxis, however it is in a neighborhood of Rome and we felt like we lived there. You can walk to the Villa Borghese park, which is stunning. The recepcion staff was outstanding. I had a problem with the room that I reserved which was my fault and they were extremely accommodating and even gave me an upgrade. The room was beautiful, huge bathroom with plush robes and slippers. The breakfast in the morning was delicious and we needed a cab for the morning to go back to the airportç when we stepped out from the breakfast our cab was there and waiting and charged us normal rates. They are also part of a mileage program with most airlines, so you can get points for your stay. Not sure about these negative ratings, but we are used to 4 & 5 star hotels and would go back there in an instant!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing like the Trip Advisor Reviews”
Reviews.Author: simcom
Reviews.Content: The Duke Hotel looks fantastic on the Internet, but don't be fooled. Most complained that the hotel is not conveniently located. That wasn't the main problem, although be prepared to wait as much as 30 minutes for a taxi and then pay a higher rate due to the "called" taxi. The best thing I can say about the hotel is the breakfast. For US travellers who are not fond of European breakfast, this one is very good. I paid for two superior rooms for 4 nights each. I would hate to see what a standard room is like. You are not allowed to control the room temperature. I think the floor would have been softer and I would put money on the fact that the sheets were originally table clothes in the dining room. Even at $ 300 per night, don't expect even one free bottle of water. When you check out - you will be charged 5 euros for a 1/2 litre of water. There were no English channels on the TV and when I checked out, the manager told me they had Sky TV. I explained that no one told us nor showed us the system. He then told me it was my fault because I did not find the channels. Overall, you will be much better off finding a different hotel when in Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: dicanio10
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to win a 3 night stay at the Duke which my wife and I have just returned from and it had to be one of the best hotel stays ever and I stay in 4 and 5 star hotels all over Europe on business. Let's get the downside out of the way. It is situated in an upmarket residential area and as such there are no restaurants, bars or metro anywhere nearby, especially in August when a lot of places will close for holidays. I went out exploring one night and found a couple of eateries near Euclide railway station that were open but they didn't look anything special. Looking at a map, it would appear close to Villa Borghese but that was a good 15 minute walk to the entrance and the park is huge! On the upside, the Duke run a complimentary shuttle bus (pre-booking is essential) that will take you to via Ludovisi which is just around the corner from the Spanish Steps or a 5 minute walk to via Veneto for restaurants. The staff at the Duke were second to none, they made us feel extremely welcome and were very friendly. The Polo Lounge was a welcoming retreat after a long day seeing the sights and although the drinks were on the expensive side (well, you have to pay for quality), we enjoyed winding down there every night. The room was a superior double which had a huge bed, large, well-equipped bathroom and flat screen TV with a number of English speaking channels and British Sky Sports which was an unusual thing for European hotels in my experience. Breakfast was included and was the standard European fare of scrambled or hard boiled eggs, bacon, fruits, cereals, pastries and juice and was most enjoyable. We pushed the boat out and had dinner there on the first night (we didn't have anywhere else to go!) and it was good without going over the top and fancy. With a bottle of wine it came to around EUR85 which was a bit over our budget but we thought 'what the heck' for a one-off special occasion. What really swung it for us though was the fantastic staff there who went out of their way to make sure you had an enjoyable stay. There were many Americans staying there as part of their European Tour along with some Brits who had finished a 7 day Mediterranean cruise and wanted a few days in Rome. Overall, a fantastic hotel and one which we hope to stay at again one day

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Duke Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Decided to go to Rome for our 10th wedding anniversary and booked 3 nights at the Duke on the assumption that we would be able to get taxis to and from the city centre. Unfortunately we arrived in the middle of a countrywide taxi strike!! If it hadn't been for the marvellous Simone, the hotel's shuttle bus driver (amongst numerous other roles), we would have developed blisters on our feet far sooner that we did. Yes this hotel is 30 - 40 minutes stoll from the Spanish Steps but I cannot recommend it highly enough. The staff were friendly, professional and exceedingly helpful. At our request they organised tickets for the Papal Audience, which is an experience my wife and I will never forget, as well as restaurants etc. The room, whilst not enormous, was perfect for our requirements (if you go to Rome and want to stay in your room, there's something wrong with you!!!!). The area is upmarket and quiet and when the taxi drivers finally decided to start working again the distance to the hotel became irrelevant. Many thanks to all at the Duke for making our stay a most wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “quite dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: AudreyScotland
Reviews.Content: Was reallly looking forward to returning to Rome after 11 years. I am ex BA cabin crew so have travelled extensively and staayed in too many hoels to count. It wasn't so much that the room was, small, it wasn't too small and I wouldn't have minded that too much, but the carpets stank, and were very dirty and stained. So much so it took me aback as the hotel seemed nice enough in the foyer. On the plus side I am slightly disabled and the room had two bathrooms, one with a bath and bidet and one with a high disabled friendly toilet and a walk in shower with seat. No balcony and decor not great, but staff were friendly and helpful, except when it came to the rooms. The food was variable, but the most annoying thing was that they charged extra for the pettiest things. The good thing was that it was extremely quiet for sleeping but on the downside I found it incredibly dull! I am 36yrs old and I felt that I was in a morgue.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Welcome Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Duke's staff were very helpful and warm, could not do enough for their guests. Rooms were clean and the free breakfast was great! Hotel is located outside the cities walls. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Yes please. More of this.”
Reviews.Author: papasqa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights and would go back at the drop of a hat. Be aware however that if you want to be in the centre of Rome then you should look for another hotel. The hotel had a courtesy car that took 6/7 people. A taxi was about 10 Euros. If you walked through the Villa Borghese to the Spanish Steps it would take at least 20 minutes. Of course it will take longer if you stop at the restaurant Orologia? I think that's the name and have to say that we generally stopped there for a small refreshment. The hotel itself was very good. We found the staff to be very helpful. They spoke good English. The bedroom was well sized for Rome and was kept clean. It was also quiet. The public areas were pleasant and it was good to sit in the peace and calm of the lounge after a frantic day in Rome. The only meal we ate in the hotel was breakfast, and to be honest it was just like the breakfast you would get in many European hotels. It was not bad but it was not outstanding either. All in all our stay was a very positeve experience

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent! Will return!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Duke is a beautiful hotel. My room was enormous, and the bathroom was big enough for ballroom dancing. Most rooms have a balcony overlooking the small neighborhood. Though the location isn't close to everything, it's not as bad as you may think, as long as you are young. I fully enjoyed the various paths to through the Villa Borghese from the hotel. It is a 30 minute brisk walk to the Spanish Steps. If you are not a fan of a good walk, sign up for the shuttle to the Spanish Steps and you'll be in the middle of Rome in no time. We caught the shuttle one day without even signing up (not guaranteed to always be the case). This is a luxuriuous hotel in my book. The dining room/lounge is magnificent. The style is wicked cool with huge leaf cutouts (10') in the ceiling, and a dome in the ceiling. The bartender was super nice. He gave us these bon-bon like treats called moi-moi (if I remember correctly) - they were made locally by hand and were great. They were topped by these magnificent chocolate truffles, probably the best I ever had, and I'm a truffle fan. Puts Godiva and others to shame. Again a local product. The concierge was super-super helpful. One of our party had to spend time in an Italian hospital and the concierge helped us tremendously with all the logistics we had to navigate in a land with a foreign (to us) tongue. On a side note - the Italians are unbelievably nice. The other hospital patients looked after my mother to make sure her needs were being met. They translated or got translators, and gave us all kinds of advice and recommendations. Just beautiful people. The Duke is nearly perfect in my book. The location isn't the best, but for this hotel in a great location, you'd pay twice as much.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
