Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend during the 6 Nations. Staff exceptionally friendly and helpful. Peaceful location with courtesy bus into the city centre. Well recommended. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice peaceful hotel”
Reviews.Author: cathy sadler-smith
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have just come back having spent a week at the Duke Hotel. I'm always worried about the star rating of hotels in Italy but this one was a true 4 star hotel. Good size rooms, marble bathroom, bath robes etc. The staff were very nice and helpful, the overall decor very pleasant. The draw back is indeed it's situation which is excentered but the plus is that it is much more quiet at night! And Italy can be noisy! The shuttle bus was great, but you have to book if going in high season - it only takes 7 persons. It is true that we were out all day visiting so did not need to go back during the day and most evenings we stayed in the centre for diner. The taxi costs anything between 6 euros to 10 euros from the centre of Rome. One negative point is the heating system in the rooms - you can't control it yourself and it was 26°C in the room - even when mentioned by 4 times, nothing was done. We had to sleep with the windows open all night. What a waste!

Reviews.Title: “A week at the Duke”
Reviews.Author: hafgrape
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from a week in Rome for New Year. We use the trip advisor reviews a lot, so thought I should add mine for the Duke. Room: Very big for Rome, huge double bed, big bathroom with bath robes, very good shower. Private balcony. Four stars. Location: this is probably what lets the Duke down. It is out of the centre and the hotel bus into the centre isn't very frequent and only takes seven so pre-booking is essential. We aren't that organised on holiday so didn't know when we would want to leave and return to the hotel. We walked through Borghese to Piazzo Popolo a few times - about 30 mins pleasant walk. We also got the bus (number 52) to and from the hotel which took 15 mins from Piazza Barberini. We were there for a week so the distance didn't matter to much as we weren't trying to cram a lot into our days. What we found annoying was that it was ifficult to nip back to the hotel to drop things off or freshen up - we tended to stay out into the evening rather than go back. We found a nice restaurant about 5 minutes walk from the hotel (SciSci). But there is not much else in the area in the way of restaurants/bars. Location - two stars. Amenities: the lounge was lovely - big sofas and english reading material. We usually had it to ourselves so don't expect a busy bar. We didn't eat in the restaurant as we stayed in town most evenings (see above). We did have room service on the first evening which wasn't great - 12 euro for a mediocre sandwich. Amenities - three stars. Staff - a lot of people mentioned that the staff were really friendly. In general we didn't find them to be any more friendly or helpful than other hotels we stay in - that's not to say they were unhelpful just normal. The waiter in the lounge however was very friendly and couldn't do enough for us. Staff 3/4 stars. We booked the Duke last minute and got a good deal (110 Euro instead of the standard 300+ euro rate. Based on that price I would up the rating to above average, however for full price I would only say the hotel is average.

Reviews.Title: “a peaceful getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the duke hotel was a wonderful place to stay on our first trip to rome. We traveled in August for our honeymoon so it wasn't crowded and the staff was very helpful and attentive to our needs. Located in a quiet neighborhood and away from the noise of a busy city. We would highly recommend the hotel to anyone who travels here and would also recommend a nearvy restaurant called Celestina.

Reviews.Title: “All good, bar the location”
Reviews.Author: JamesStoker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a 3 nights in November and enjoyed our stay. The rooms were clean, spacious and had a good standard of decor. Service was excellent and very friendly. Also, the breakfast was good, with a nice spread of choices. The only drawback was the location jsut outside of the city centre. It didn't bother us too much as you could get the free shuttle bus or a taxi, but it would have been nice to have had the main sights within easy walking distance. All in all a very pleasant stay and good value.

Reviews.Title: “very nice & quiet”
Reviews.Author: gjamain
Reviews.Content: Very good deal for around 220 eur a night in a double deluxe room of 20m². Very nice hotel in a traditional roman style and very stylish rooms : e.g. bathroom in green marble with beige plank, pure flax sheets... Amazing breakfast included (english & continental with local pastries ; 4 fresh fruit juices ; 8 different jams....). Not really in downtown but 15mn by car from colloseum. As a summary, a very good deal when you accept not to be in downtown, but expect a nice place to rest (and you will need it in rome !) and have breakfast. We did not eat lunch or dinner, so no opinion. Hotel provided for free any reservation (restaurant, museum) we wanted, 2 tickets for Manet Exhibition, and a shuttle service to near downtown. Beware of minibar : very expensive as well as supplements were !

HotelInfo.Name: Duke Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Archimede 69, 00197 Rome, Italy
